-- | The maximum number of bytes that can be retrieved in an hour.
--

module Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.Encryption

-- | Contains information about the encryption used to store the job
--   results in Amazon S3.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEncryption</a> smart constructor.
data Encryption
Encryption' :: Maybe EncryptionType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Encryption

-- | The server-side encryption algorithm used when storing job results in
--   Amazon S3, for example <tt>AES256</tt> or <tt>aws:kms</tt>.
[$sel:encryptionType:Encryption'] :: Encryption -> Maybe EncryptionType

-- | The AWS KMS key ID to use for object encryption. All GET and PUT
--   requests for an object protected by AWS KMS fail if not made by using
--   Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) or Signature Version 4.
[$sel:kmsKeyId:Encryption'] :: Encryption -> Maybe Text

-- | Optional. If the encryption type is <tt>aws:kms</tt>, you can use this
--   value to specify the encryption context for the job results.
[$sel:kmsContext:Encryption'] :: Encryption -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Encryption</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:encryptionType:Encryption'</a>,
--   <a>encryption_encryptionType</a> - The server-side encryption
--   algorithm used when storing job results in Amazon S3, for example
--   <tt>AES256</tt> or <tt>aws:kms</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsKeyId:Encryption'</a>, <a>encryption_kmsKeyId</a> - The AWS
--   KMS key ID to use for object encryption. All GET and PUT requests for
--   an object protected by AWS KMS fail if not made by using Secure
--   Sockets Layer (SSL) or Signature Version 4.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kmsContext:Encryption'</a>, <a>encryption_kmsContext</a> -
--   Optional. If the encryption type is <tt>aws:kms</tt>, you can use this
--   value to specify the encryption context for the job results.
newEncryption :: Encryption

-- | The server-side encryption algorithm used when storing job results in
--   Amazon S3, for example <tt>AES256</tt> or <tt>aws:kms</tt>.
encryption_encryptionType :: Lens' Encryption (Maybe EncryptionType)

-- | The AWS KMS key ID to use for object encryption. All GET and PUT
--   requests for an object protected by AWS KMS fail if not made by using
--   Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) or Signature Version 4.
encryption_kmsKeyId :: Lens' Encryption (Maybe Text)

-- | Optional. If the encryption type is <tt>aws:kms</tt>, you can use this
--   value to specify the encryption context for the job results.
encryption_kmsContext :: Lens' Encryption (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.Encryption.Encryption
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.Encryption.Encryption
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.Encryption.Encryption
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.Encryption.Encryption

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.ExpressionType.ExpressionType


module Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.FileHeaderInfo
newtype FileHeaderInfo
FileHeaderInfo' :: Text -> FileHeaderInfo
[fromFileHeaderInfo] :: FileHeaderInfo -> Text
pattern FileHeaderInfo_IGNORE :: FileHeaderInfo
pattern FileHeaderInfo_NONE :: FileHeaderInfo
pattern FileHeaderInfo_USE :: FileHeaderInfo
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.FileHeaderInfo.FileHeaderInfo
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.FileHeaderInfo.FileHeaderInfo
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.FileHeaderInfo.FileHeaderInfo
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.FileHeaderInfo.FileHeaderInfo
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSONKey Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.FileHeaderInfo.FileHeaderInfo
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.FileHeaderInfo.FileHeaderInfo
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.FileHeaderInfo.FileHeaderInfo
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeader Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.FileHeaderInfo.FileHeaderInfo
instance Network.AWS.Data.Log.ToLog Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.FileHeaderInfo.FileHeaderInfo

instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.FromText Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.FileHeaderInfo.FileHeaderInfo

instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.FileHeaderInfo.FileHeaderInfo
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.FileHeaderInfo.FileHeaderInfo
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.FileHeaderInfo.FileHeaderInfo
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.FileHeaderInfo.FileHeaderInfo
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.FileHeaderInfo.FileHeaderInfo
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.FileHeaderInfo.FileHeaderInfo


module Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.CSVInput

-- | Contains information about the comma-separated value (CSV) file to
--   select from.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCSVInput</a> smart constructor.
data CSVInput
CSVInput' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe FileHeaderInfo -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> CSVInput

-- | A value used to separate individual records from each other.
[$sel:recordDelimiter:CSVInput'] :: CSVInput -> Maybe Text

-- | A value used as an escape character where the field delimiter is part
--   of the value.
[$sel:quoteCharacter:CSVInput'] :: CSVInput -> Maybe Text

-- | Describes the first line of input. Valid values are <tt>None</tt>,
--   <tt>Ignore</tt>, and <tt>Use</tt>.
[$sel:fileHeaderInfo:CSVInput'] :: CSVInput -> Maybe FileHeaderInfo

-- | A value used to separate individual fields from each other within a
--   record.
[$sel:fieldDelimiter:CSVInput'] :: CSVInput -> Maybe Text

-- | A single character used to indicate that a row should be ignored when
--   the character is present at the start of that row.
[$sel:comments:CSVInput'] :: CSVInput -> Maybe Text

-- | A single character used for escaping the quotation-mark character
--   inside an already escaped value.
[$sel:quoteEscapeCharacter:CSVInput'] :: CSVInput -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CSVInput</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:recordDelimiter:CSVInput'</a>, <a>cSVInput_recordDelimiter</a>
--   - A value used to separate individual records from each other.
--   
--   <a>$sel:quoteCharacter:CSVInput'</a>, <a>cSVInput_quoteCharacter</a> -
--   A value used as an escape character where the field delimiter is part
--   of the value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fileHeaderInfo:CSVInput'</a>, <a>cSVInput_fileHeaderInfo</a> -
--   Describes the first line of input. Valid values are <tt>None</tt>,
--   <tt>Ignore</tt>, and <tt>Use</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fieldDelimiter:CSVInput'</a>, <a>cSVInput_fieldDelimiter</a> -
--   A value used to separate individual fields from each other within a
--   record.
--   
--   <a>$sel:comments:CSVInput'</a>, <a>cSVInput_comments</a> - A single
--   character used to indicate that a row should be ignored when the
--   character is present at the start of that row.
--   
--   <a>$sel:quoteEscapeCharacter:CSVInput'</a>,
--   <a>cSVInput_quoteEscapeCharacter</a> - A single character used for
--   escaping the quotation-mark character inside an already escaped value.
newCSVInput :: CSVInput

-- | A value used to separate individual records from each other.
cSVInput_recordDelimiter :: Lens' CSVInput (Maybe Text)

-- | A value used as an escape character where the field delimiter is part
--   of the value.
cSVInput_quoteCharacter :: Lens' CSVInput (Maybe Text)

-- | Describes the first line of input. Valid values are <tt>None</tt>,
--   <tt>Ignore</tt>, and <tt>Use</tt>.
cSVInput_fileHeaderInfo :: Lens' CSVInput (Maybe FileHeaderInfo)

-- | A value used to separate individual fields from each other within a
--   record.
cSVInput_fieldDelimiter :: Lens' CSVInput (Maybe Text)

-- | A single character used to indicate that a row should be ignored when
--   the character is present at the start of that row.
cSVInput_comments :: Lens' CSVInput (Maybe Text)

-- | A single character used for escaping the quotation-mark character
--   inside an already escaped value.
cSVInput_quoteEscapeCharacter :: Lens' CSVInput (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.CSVInput.CSVInput
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.CSVInput.CSVInput
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.CSVInput.CSVInput
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.CSVInput.CSVInput
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.CSVInput.CSVInput
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.CSVInput.CSVInput
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.CSVInput.CSVInput
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.CSVInput.CSVInput


module Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.InputSerialization

-- | Describes how the archive is serialized.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInputSerialization</a> smart constructor.
data InputSerialization
InputSerialization' :: Maybe CSVInput -> InputSerialization

-- | Describes the serialization of a CSV-encoded object.
[$sel:csv:InputSerialization'] :: InputSerialization -> Maybe CSVInput

-- | Create a value of <a>InputSerialization</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:csv:InputSerialization'</a>, <a>inputSerialization_csv</a> -
--   Describes the serialization of a CSV-encoded object.
newInputSerialization :: InputSerialization

-- | Describes the serialization of a CSV-encoded object.
inputSerialization_csv :: Lens' InputSerialization (Maybe CSVInput)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.InputSerialization.InputSerialization
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.InputSerialization.InputSerialization
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.InputSerialization.InputSerialization
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.InputSerialization.InputSerialization
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.InputSerialization.InputSerialization
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.InputSerialization.InputSerialization
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.InputSerialization.InputSerialization
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.InputSerialization.InputSerialization


module Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.InventoryRetrievalJobDescription

-- | Describes the options for a range inventory retrieval job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInventoryRetrievalJobDescription</a> smart
--   constructor.
data InventoryRetrievalJobDescription
InventoryRetrievalJobDescription' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> InventoryRetrievalJobDescription

-- | The start of the date range in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC) for
--   vault inventory retrieval that includes archives created on or after
--   this date. This value should be a string in the ISO 8601 date format,
--   for example <tt>2013-03-20T17:03:43Z</tt>.
[$sel:startDate:InventoryRetrievalJobDescription'] :: InventoryRetrievalJobDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The output format for the vault inventory list, which is set by the
--   <b>InitiateJob</b> request when initiating a job to retrieve a vault
--   inventory. Valid values are <tt>CSV</tt> and <tt>JSON</tt>.
[$sel:format:InventoryRetrievalJobDescription'] :: InventoryRetrievalJobDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The end of the date range in UTC for vault inventory retrieval that
--   includes archives created before this date. This value should be a
--   string in the ISO 8601 date format, for example
--   <tt>2013-03-20T17:03:43Z</tt>.
[$sel:endDate:InventoryRetrievalJobDescription'] :: InventoryRetrievalJobDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of inventory items returned per vault inventory
--   retrieval request. This limit is set when initiating the job with the
--   a <b>InitiateJob</b> request.
[$sel:limit:InventoryRetrievalJobDescription'] :: InventoryRetrievalJobDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | An opaque string that represents where to continue pagination of the
--   vault inventory retrieval results. You use the marker in a new
--   <b>InitiateJob</b> request to obtain additional inventory items. If
--   there are no more inventory items, this value is <tt>null</tt>. For
--   more information, see <a>Range Inventory Retrieval</a>.
[$sel:marker:InventoryRetrievalJobDescription'] :: InventoryRetrievalJobDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>InventoryRetrievalJobDescription</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:startDate:InventoryRetrievalJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>inventoryRetrievalJobDescription_startDate</a> - The start of the
--   date range in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC) for vault inventory
--   retrieval that includes archives created on or after this date. This
--   value should be a string in the ISO 8601 date format, for example
--   <tt>2013-03-20T17:03:43Z</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:format:InventoryRetrievalJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>inventoryRetrievalJobDescription_format</a> - The output format for
--   the vault inventory list, which is set by the <b>InitiateJob</b>
--   request when initiating a job to retrieve a vault inventory. Valid
--   values are <tt>CSV</tt> and <tt>JSON</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endDate:InventoryRetrievalJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>inventoryRetrievalJobDescription_endDate</a> - The end of the date
--   range in UTC for vault inventory retrieval that includes archives
--   created before this date. This value should be a string in the ISO
--   8601 date format, for example <tt>2013-03-20T17:03:43Z</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:limit:InventoryRetrievalJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>inventoryRetrievalJobDescription_limit</a> - The maximum number of
--   inventory items returned per vault inventory retrieval request. This
--   limit is set when initiating the job with the a <b>InitiateJob</b>
--   request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:marker:InventoryRetrievalJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>inventoryRetrievalJobDescription_marker</a> - An opaque string that
--   represents where to continue pagination of the vault inventory
--   retrieval results. You use the marker in a new <b>InitiateJob</b>
--   request to obtain additional inventory items. If there are no more
--   inventory items, this value is <tt>null</tt>. For more information,
--   see <a>Range Inventory Retrieval</a>.
newInventoryRetrievalJobDescription :: InventoryRetrievalJobDescription

-- | The start of the date range in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC) for
--   vault inventory retrieval that includes archives created on or after
--   this date. This value should be a string in the ISO 8601 date format,
--   for example <tt>2013-03-20T17:03:43Z</tt>.
inventoryRetrievalJobDescription_startDate :: Lens' InventoryRetrievalJobDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The output format for the vault inventory list, which is set by the
--   <b>InitiateJob</b> request when initiating a job to retrieve a vault
--   inventory. Valid values are <tt>CSV</tt> and <tt>JSON</tt>.
inventoryRetrievalJobDescription_format :: Lens' InventoryRetrievalJobDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The end of the date range in UTC for vault inventory retrieval that
--   includes archives created before this date. This value should be a
--   string in the ISO 8601 date format, for example
--   <tt>2013-03-20T17:03:43Z</tt>.
inventoryRetrievalJobDescription_endDate :: Lens' InventoryRetrievalJobDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of inventory items returned per vault inventory
--   retrieval request. This limit is set when initiating the job with the
--   a <b>InitiateJob</b> request.
inventoryRetrievalJobDescription_limit :: Lens' InventoryRetrievalJobDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | An opaque string that represents where to continue pagination of the
--   vault inventory retrieval results. You use the marker in a new
--   <b>InitiateJob</b> request to obtain additional inventory items. If
--   there are no more inventory items, this value is <tt>null</tt>. For
--   more information, see <a>Range Inventory Retrieval</a>.
inventoryRetrievalJobDescription_marker :: Lens' InventoryRetrievalJobDescription (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.InventoryRetrievalJobDescription.InventoryRetrievalJobDescription
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.InventoryRetrievalJobDescription.InventoryRetrievalJobDescription
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.InventoryRetrievalJobDescription.InventoryRetrievalJobDescription
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.InventoryRetrievalJobDescription.InventoryRetrievalJobDescription
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.InventoryRetrievalJobDescription.InventoryRetrievalJobDescription
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.InventoryRetrievalJobDescription.InventoryRetrievalJobDescription
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.InventoryRetrievalJobDescription.InventoryRetrievalJobDescription


module Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.InventoryRetrievalJobInput

-- | Provides options for specifying a range inventory retrieval job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInventoryRetrievalJobInput</a> smart constructor.
data InventoryRetrievalJobInput
InventoryRetrievalJobInput' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> InventoryRetrievalJobInput

-- | The start of the date range in UTC for vault inventory retrieval that
--   includes archives created on or after this date. This value should be
--   a string in the ISO 8601 date format, for example
--   <tt>2013-03-20T17:03:43Z</tt>.
[$sel:startDate:InventoryRetrievalJobInput'] :: InventoryRetrievalJobInput -> Maybe Text

-- | The end of the date range in UTC for vault inventory retrieval that
--   includes archives created before this date. This value should be a
--   string in the ISO 8601 date format, for example
--   <tt>2013-03-20T17:03:43Z</tt>.
[$sel:endDate:InventoryRetrievalJobInput'] :: InventoryRetrievalJobInput -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the maximum number of inventory items returned per vault
--   inventory retrieval request. Valid values are greater than or equal to
--   1.
[$sel:limit:InventoryRetrievalJobInput'] :: InventoryRetrievalJobInput -> Maybe Text

-- | An opaque string that represents where to continue pagination of the
--   vault inventory retrieval results. You use the marker in a new
--   <b>InitiateJob</b> request to obtain additional inventory items. If
--   there are no more inventory items, this value is <tt>null</tt>.
[$sel:marker:InventoryRetrievalJobInput'] :: InventoryRetrievalJobInput -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>InventoryRetrievalJobInput</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:startDate:InventoryRetrievalJobInput'</a>,
--   <a>inventoryRetrievalJobInput_startDate</a> - The start of the date
--   range in UTC for vault inventory retrieval that includes archives
--   created on or after this date. This value should be a string in the
--   ISO 8601 date format, for example <tt>2013-03-20T17:03:43Z</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endDate:InventoryRetrievalJobInput'</a>,
--   <a>inventoryRetrievalJobInput_endDate</a> - The end of the date range
--   in UTC for vault inventory retrieval that includes archives created
--   before this date. This value should be a string in the ISO 8601 date
--   format, for example <tt>2013-03-20T17:03:43Z</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:limit:InventoryRetrievalJobInput'</a>,
--   <a>inventoryRetrievalJobInput_limit</a> - Specifies the maximum number
--   of inventory items returned per vault inventory retrieval request.
--   Valid values are greater than or equal to 1.
--   
--   <a>$sel:marker:InventoryRetrievalJobInput'</a>,
--   <a>inventoryRetrievalJobInput_marker</a> - An opaque string that
--   represents where to continue pagination of the vault inventory
--   retrieval results. You use the marker in a new <b>InitiateJob</b>
--   request to obtain additional inventory items. If there are no more
--   inventory items, this value is <tt>null</tt>.
newInventoryRetrievalJobInput :: InventoryRetrievalJobInput

-- | The start of the date range in UTC for vault inventory retrieval that
--   includes archives created on or after this date. This value should be
--   a string in the ISO 8601 date format, for example
--   <tt>2013-03-20T17:03:43Z</tt>.
inventoryRetrievalJobInput_startDate :: Lens' InventoryRetrievalJobInput (Maybe Text)

-- | The end of the date range in UTC for vault inventory retrieval that
--   includes archives created before this date. This value should be a
--   string in the ISO 8601 date format, for example
--   <tt>2013-03-20T17:03:43Z</tt>.
inventoryRetrievalJobInput_endDate :: Lens' InventoryRetrievalJobInput (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the maximum number of inventory items returned per vault
--   inventory retrieval request. Valid values are greater than or equal to
--   1.
inventoryRetrievalJobInput_limit :: Lens' InventoryRetrievalJobInput (Maybe Text)

-- | An opaque string that represents where to continue pagination of the
--   vault inventory retrieval results. You use the marker in a new
--   <b>InitiateJob</b> request to obtain additional inventory items. If
--   there are no more inventory items, this value is <tt>null</tt>.
inventoryRetrievalJobInput_marker :: Lens' InventoryRetrievalJobInput (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.InventoryRetrievalJobInput.InventoryRetrievalJobInput
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.InventoryRetrievalJobInput.InventoryRetrievalJobInput
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.InventoryRetrievalJobInput.InventoryRetrievalJobInput
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.InventoryRetrievalJobInput.InventoryRetrievalJobInput
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.InventoryRetrievalJobInput.InventoryRetrievalJobInput
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.InventoryRetrievalJobInput.InventoryRetrievalJobInput
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.InventoryRetrievalJobInput.InventoryRetrievalJobInput


module Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.PartListElement

-- | A list of the part sizes of the multipart upload.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPartListElement</a> smart constructor.
data PartListElement
PartListElement' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> PartListElement

-- | The SHA256 tree hash value that Amazon S3 Glacier calculated for the
--   part. This field is never <tt>null</tt>.
[$sel:sHA256TreeHash:PartListElement'] :: PartListElement -> Maybe Text

-- | The byte range of a part, inclusive of the upper value of the range.
[$sel:rangeInBytes:PartListElement'] :: PartListElement -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>PartListElement</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sHA256TreeHash:PartListElement'</a>,
--   <a>partListElement_sHA256TreeHash</a> - The SHA256 tree hash value
--   that Amazon S3 Glacier calculated for the part. This field is never
--   <tt>null</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rangeInBytes:PartListElement'</a>,
--   <a>partListElement_rangeInBytes</a> - The byte range of a part,
--   inclusive of the upper value of the range.
newPartListElement :: PartListElement

-- | The SHA256 tree hash value that Amazon S3 Glacier calculated for the
--   part. This field is never <tt>null</tt>.
partListElement_sHA256TreeHash :: Lens' PartListElement (Maybe Text)

-- | The byte range of a part, inclusive of the upper value of the range.
partListElement_rangeInBytes :: Lens' PartListElement (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.PartListElement.PartListElement
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.PartListElement.PartListElement
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.PartListElement.PartListElement
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.PartListElement.PartListElement
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.PartListElement.PartListElement
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.PartListElement.PartListElement
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.PartListElement.PartListElement


module Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.Permission
newtype Permission
Permission' :: Text -> Permission
[fromPermission] :: Permission -> Text
pattern Permission_FULL_CONTROL :: Permission
pattern Permission_READ :: Permission
pattern Permission_READ_ACP :: Permission
pattern Permission_WRITE :: Permission
pattern Permission_WRITE_ACP :: Permission
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.Permission.Permission
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.Permission.Permission
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.Permission.Permission
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.Permission.Permission
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSONKey Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.Permission.Permission
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.Permission.Permission
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.Permission.Permission
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeader Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.Permission.Permission
instance Network.AWS.Data.Log.ToLog Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.Permission.Permission
instance Network.AWS.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.Permission.Permission
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.ToText Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.Permission.Permission
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.FromText Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.Permission.Permission
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.Permission.Permission
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.Permission.Permission
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.Permission.Permission
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.Permission.Permission
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.Permission.Permission
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.Permission.Permission
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.Permission.Permission


module Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.ProvisionedCapacityDescription

-- | The definition for a provisioned capacity unit.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newProvisionedCapacityDescription</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ProvisionedCapacityDescription
ProvisionedCapacityDescription' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ProvisionedCapacityDescription

-- | The date that the provisioned capacity unit was purchased, in
--   Universal Coordinated Time (UTC).
[$sel:startDate:ProvisionedCapacityDescription'] :: ProvisionedCapacityDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID that identifies the provisioned capacity unit.
[$sel:capacityId:ProvisionedCapacityDescription'] :: ProvisionedCapacityDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The date that the provisioned capacity unit expires, in Universal
--   Coordinated Time (UTC).
[$sel:expirationDate:ProvisionedCapacityDescription'] :: ProvisionedCapacityDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ProvisionedCapacityDescription</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:startDate:ProvisionedCapacityDescription'</a>,
--   <a>provisionedCapacityDescription_startDate</a> - The date that the
--   provisioned capacity unit was purchased, in Universal Coordinated Time
--   (UTC).
--   
--   <a>$sel:capacityId:ProvisionedCapacityDescription'</a>,
--   <a>provisionedCapacityDescription_capacityId</a> - The ID that
--   identifies the provisioned capacity unit.
--   
--   <a>$sel:expirationDate:ProvisionedCapacityDescription'</a>,
--   <a>provisionedCapacityDescription_expirationDate</a> - The date that
--   the provisioned capacity unit expires, in Universal Coordinated Time
--   (UTC).
newProvisionedCapacityDescription :: ProvisionedCapacityDescription

-- | The date that the provisioned capacity unit was purchased, in
--   Universal Coordinated Time (UTC).
provisionedCapacityDescription_startDate :: Lens' ProvisionedCapacityDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID that identifies the provisioned capacity unit.
provisionedCapacityDescription_capacityId :: Lens' ProvisionedCapacityDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The date that the provisioned capacity unit expires, in Universal
--   Coordinated Time (UTC).
provisionedCapacityDescription_expirationDate :: Lens' ProvisionedCapacityDescription (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.ProvisionedCapacityDescription.ProvisionedCapacityDescription
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.ProvisionedCapacityDescription.ProvisionedCapacityDescription
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.ProvisionedCapacityDescription.ProvisionedCapacityDescription
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.ProvisionedCapacityDescription.ProvisionedCapacityDescription
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.ProvisionedCapacityDescription.ProvisionedCapacityDescription
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.ProvisionedCapacityDescription.ProvisionedCapacityDescription
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.ProvisionedCapacityDescription.ProvisionedCapacityDescription

[fromQuoteFields] :: QuoteFields -> Text
pattern QuoteFields_ALWAYS :: QuoteFields
pattern QuoteFields_ASNEEDED :: QuoteFields

module Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.CSVOutput

-- | Contains information about the comma-separated value (CSV) file that
--   the job results are stored in.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCSVOutput</a> smart constructor.
data CSVOutput
CSVOutput' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe QuoteFields -> Maybe Text -> CSVOutput

-- | A value used to separate individual records from each other.
[$sel:recordDelimiter:CSVOutput'] :: CSVOutput -> Maybe Text

-- | A value used as an escape character where the field delimiter is part
--   of the value.
[$sel:quoteCharacter:CSVOutput'] :: CSVOutput -> Maybe Text

-- | A value used to separate individual fields from each other within a
--   record.
[$sel:fieldDelimiter:CSVOutput'] :: CSVOutput -> Maybe Text

-- | A value that indicates whether all output fields should be contained
--   within quotation marks.
[$sel:quoteFields:CSVOutput'] :: CSVOutput -> Maybe QuoteFields

-- | A single character used for escaping the quotation-mark character
--   inside an already escaped value.
[$sel:quoteEscapeCharacter:CSVOutput'] :: CSVOutput -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CSVOutput</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:recordDelimiter:CSVOutput'</a>,
--   <a>cSVOutput_recordDelimiter</a> - A value used to separate individual
--   records from each other.
--   
--   <a>$sel:quoteCharacter:CSVOutput'</a>, <a>cSVOutput_quoteCharacter</a>
--   - A value used as an escape character where the field delimiter is
--   part of the value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fieldDelimiter:CSVOutput'</a>, <a>cSVOutput_fieldDelimiter</a>
--   - A value used to separate individual fields from each other within a
--   record.
--   
--   <a>$sel:quoteFields:CSVOutput'</a>, <a>cSVOutput_quoteFields</a> - A
--   value that indicates whether all output fields should be contained
--   within quotation marks.
--   
--   <a>$sel:quoteEscapeCharacter:CSVOutput'</a>,
--   <a>cSVOutput_quoteEscapeCharacter</a> - A single character used for
--   escaping the quotation-mark character inside an already escaped value.
newCSVOutput :: CSVOutput

-- | A value used to separate individual records from each other.
cSVOutput_recordDelimiter :: Lens' CSVOutput (Maybe Text)

-- | A value used as an escape character where the field delimiter is part
--   of the value.
cSVOutput_quoteCharacter :: Lens' CSVOutput (Maybe Text)

-- | A value used to separate individual fields from each other within a
--   record.
cSVOutput_fieldDelimiter :: Lens' CSVOutput (Maybe Text)

-- | A value that indicates whether all output fields should be contained
--   within quotation marks.
cSVOutput_quoteFields :: Lens' CSVOutput (Maybe QuoteFields)

-- | A single character used for escaping the quotation-mark character
--   inside an already escaped value.
cSVOutput_quoteEscapeCharacter :: Lens' CSVOutput (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.CSVOutput.CSVOutput
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.CSVOutput.CSVOutput
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.CSVOutput.CSVOutput
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.CSVOutput.CSVOutput
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.CSVOutput.CSVOutput
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.CSVOutput.CSVOutput
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.CSVOutput.CSVOutput
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.CSVOutput.CSVOutput


module Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.OutputSerialization

-- | Describes how the select output is serialized.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOutputSerialization</a> smart constructor.
data OutputSerialization
OutputSerialization' :: Maybe CSVOutput -> OutputSerialization

-- | Describes the serialization of CSV-encoded query results.
[$sel:csv:OutputSerialization'] :: OutputSerialization -> Maybe CSVOutput

-- | Create a value of <a>OutputSerialization</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:csv:OutputSerialization'</a>, <a>outputSerialization_csv</a> -
--   Describes the serialization of CSV-encoded query results.
newOutputSerialization :: OutputSerialization

-- | Describes the serialization of CSV-encoded query results.
outputSerialization_csv :: Lens' OutputSerialization (Maybe CSVOutput)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.OutputSerialization.OutputSerialization
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.OutputSerialization.OutputSerialization
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.OutputSerialization.OutputSerialization
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.OutputSerialization.OutputSerialization
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.OutputSerialization.OutputSerialization
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.OutputSerialization.OutputSerialization
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.OutputSerialization.OutputSerialization
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.OutputSerialization.OutputSerialization


module Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.SelectParameters

-- | Contains information about the parameters used for a select.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSelectParameters</a> smart constructor.
data SelectParameters
SelectParameters' :: Maybe ExpressionType -> Maybe OutputSerialization -> Maybe InputSerialization -> Maybe Text -> SelectParameters

-- | The type of the provided expression, for example <tt>SQL</tt>.
[$sel:expressionType:SelectParameters'] :: SelectParameters -> Maybe ExpressionType

-- | Describes how the results of the select job are serialized.
[$sel:outputSerialization:SelectParameters'] :: SelectParameters -> Maybe OutputSerialization

-- | Describes the serialization format of the object.
[$sel:inputSerialization:SelectParameters'] :: SelectParameters -> Maybe InputSerialization

-- | The expression that is used to select the object.
[$sel:expression:SelectParameters'] :: SelectParameters -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SelectParameters</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:expressionType:SelectParameters'</a>,
--   <a>selectParameters_expressionType</a> - The type of the provided
--   expression, for example <tt>SQL</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputSerialization:SelectParameters'</a>,
--   <a>selectParameters_outputSerialization</a> - Describes how the
--   results of the select job are serialized.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inputSerialization:SelectParameters'</a>,
--   <a>selectParameters_inputSerialization</a> - Describes the
--   serialization format of the object.
--   
--   <a>$sel:expression:SelectParameters'</a>,
--   <a>selectParameters_expression</a> - The expression that is used to
--   select the object.
newSelectParameters :: SelectParameters

-- | The type of the provided expression, for example <tt>SQL</tt>.
selectParameters_expressionType :: Lens' SelectParameters (Maybe ExpressionType)

-- | Describes how the results of the select job are serialized.
selectParameters_outputSerialization :: Lens' SelectParameters (Maybe OutputSerialization)

-- | Describes the serialization format of the object.
selectParameters_inputSerialization :: Lens' SelectParameters (Maybe InputSerialization)

-- | The expression that is used to select the object.
selectParameters_expression :: Lens' SelectParameters (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.SelectParameters.SelectParameters
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.SelectParameters.SelectParameters
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.SelectParameters.SelectParameters
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.SelectParameters.SelectParameters
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.SelectParameters.SelectParameters
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.SelectParameters.SelectParameters
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.SelectParameters.SelectParameters
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Glacier.Types.SelectParameters.SelectParameters
