-- | This operation retrieves the following attributes from the
--   <tt>lock-policy</tt> subresource set on the specified vault:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The vault lock policy set on the vault.</li>
--   <li>The state of the vault lock, which is either <tt>InProgess</tt> or
--   <tt>Locked</tt>.</li>
--   <li>When the lock ID expires. The lock ID is used to complete the
--   vault locking process.</li>
--   <li>When the vault lock was initiated and put into the
--   <tt>InProgress</tt> state.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   A vault lock is put into the <tt>InProgress</tt> state by calling
--   InitiateVaultLock. A vault lock is put into the <tt>Locked</tt> state
--   by calling CompleteVaultLock. You can abort the vault locking process
--   by calling AbortVaultLock. For more information about the vault
--   locking process, <a>Amazon Glacier Vault Lock</a>.
--   
--   If there is no vault lock policy set on the vault, the operation
--   returns a <tt>404 Not found</tt> error. For more information about
--   vault lock policies, <a>Amazon Glacier Access Control with Vault Lock
--   Policies</a>.
module Network.AWS.Glacier.GetVaultLock

-- | The input values for <tt>GetVaultLock</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetVaultLock</a> smart constructor.
data GetVaultLock
GetVaultLock' :: Text -> Text -> GetVaultLock

-- | The <tt>AccountId</tt> value is the AWS account ID of the account that
--   owns the vault. You can either specify an AWS account ID or optionally
--   a single '<tt>-</tt>' (hyphen), in which case Amazon S3 Glacier uses
--   the AWS account ID associated with the credentials used to sign the
--   request. If you use an account ID, do not include any hyphens ('-') in
--   the ID.
[$sel:accountId:GetVaultLock'] :: GetVaultLock -> Text

-- | The name of the vault.
[$sel:vaultName:GetVaultLock'] :: GetVaultLock -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GetVaultLock</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:GetVaultLock'</a>, <a>getVaultLock_accountId</a> -
--   The <tt>AccountId</tt> value is the AWS account ID of the account that
--   owns the vault. You can either specify an AWS account ID or optionally
--   a single '<tt>-</tt>' (hyphen), in which case Amazon S3 Glacier uses
--   the AWS account ID associated with the credentials used to sign the
--   request. If you use an account ID, do not include any hyphens ('-') in
--   the ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vaultName:GetVaultLock'</a>, <a>getVaultLock_vaultName</a> -
--   The name of the vault.
newGetVaultLock :: Text -> Text -> GetVaultLock

-- | The <tt>AccountId</tt> value is the AWS account ID of the account that
--   owns the vault. You can either specify an AWS account ID or optionally
--   a single '<tt>-</tt>' (hyphen), in which case Amazon S3 Glacier uses
--   the AWS account ID associated with the credentials used to sign the
--   request. If you use an account ID, do not include any hyphens ('-') in
--   the ID.
getVaultLock_accountId :: Lens' GetVaultLock Text

-- | The name of the vault.
getVaultLock_vaultName :: Lens' GetVaultLock Text

-- | Contains the Amazon S3 Glacier response to your request.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetVaultLockResponse</a> smart constructor.
data GetVaultLockResponse
GetVaultLockResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Int -> GetVaultLockResponse

-- | The UTC date and time at which the vault lock was put into the
--   <tt>InProgress</tt> state.
[$sel:creationDate:GetVaultLockResponse'] :: GetVaultLockResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The UTC date and time at which the lock ID expires. This value can be
--   <tt>null</tt> if the vault lock is in a <tt>Locked</tt> state.
[$sel:expirationDate:GetVaultLockResponse'] :: GetVaultLockResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The state of the vault lock. <tt>InProgress</tt> or <tt>Locked</tt>.
[$sel:state:GetVaultLockResponse'] :: GetVaultLockResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The vault lock policy as a JSON string, which uses "\" as an escape
--   character.
[$sel:policy:GetVaultLockResponse'] :: GetVaultLockResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:GetVaultLockResponse'] :: GetVaultLockResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>GetVaultLockResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:GetVaultLockResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getVaultLockResponse_creationDate</a> - The UTC date and time at
--   which the vault lock was put into the <tt>InProgress</tt> state.
--   
--   <a>$sel:expirationDate:GetVaultLockResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getVaultLockResponse_expirationDate</a> - The UTC date and time at
--   which the lock ID expires. This value can be <tt>null</tt> if the
--   vault lock is in a <tt>Locked</tt> state.
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:GetVaultLockResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getVaultLockResponse_state</a> - The state of the vault lock.
--   <tt>InProgress</tt> or <tt>Locked</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policy:GetVaultLockResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getVaultLockResponse_policy</a> - The vault lock policy as a JSON
--   string, which uses "\" as an escape character.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:GetVaultLockResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getVaultLockResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newGetVaultLockResponse :: Int -> GetVaultLockResponse

-- | The UTC date and time at which the vault lock was put into the
--   <tt>InProgress</tt> state.
getVaultLockResponse_creationDate :: Lens' GetVaultLockResponse (Maybe Text)

--   <tt>null</tt> if the vault lock is in a <tt>Locked</tt> state.
getVaultLockResponse_expirationDate :: Lens' GetVaultLockResponse (Maybe Text)

--   character.

-- | This operation retrieves the <tt>access-policy</tt> subresource set on
--   the vault; for more information on setting this subresource, see
--   <a>Set Vault Access Policy (PUT access-policy)</a>. If there is no
--   access policy set on the vault, the operation returns a <tt>404 Not
--   found</tt> error. For more information about vault access policies,
--   see <a>Amazon Glacier Access Control with Vault Access Policies</a>.
module Network.AWS.Glacier.GetVaultAccessPolicy

-- | Input for GetVaultAccessPolicy.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetVaultAccessPolicy</a> smart constructor.
data GetVaultAccessPolicy
GetVaultAccessPolicy' :: Text -> Text -> GetVaultAccessPolicy

-- | The <tt>AccountId</tt> value is the AWS account ID of the account that
--   owns the vault. You can either specify an AWS account ID or optionally
--   a single '<tt>-</tt>' (hyphen), in which case Amazon S3 Glacier uses
--   the AWS account ID associated with the credentials used to sign the
--   request. If you use an account ID, do not include any hyphens ('-') in
--   the ID.
[$sel:accountId:GetVaultAccessPolicy'] :: GetVaultAccessPolicy -> Text

-- | The name of the vault.
[$sel:vaultName:GetVaultAccessPolicy'] :: GetVaultAccessPolicy -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GetVaultAccessPolicy</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.

--   is the AWS account ID of the account that owns the vault. You can
--   either specify an AWS account ID or optionally a single '<tt>-</tt>'
--   (hyphen), in which case Amazon S3 Glacier uses the AWS account ID
--   associated with the credentials used to sign the request. If you use
--   an account ID, do not include any hyphens ('-') in the ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vaultName:GetVaultAccessPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>getVaultAccessPolicy_vaultName</a> - The name of the vault.
newGetVaultAccessPolicy :: Text -> Text -> GetVaultAccessPolicy

--   owns the vault. You can either specify an AWS account ID or optionally
--   a single '<tt>-</tt>' (hyphen), in which case Amazon S3 Glacier uses
--   the AWS account ID associated with the credentials used to sign the
--   request. If you use an account ID, do not include any hyphens ('-') in
--   the ID.

-- | This operation downloads the output of the job you initiated using
--   InitiateJob. Depending on the job type you specified when you
--   initiated the job, the output will be either the content of an archive
--   or a vault inventory.
--   
--   You can download all the job output or download a portion of the
--   output by specifying a byte range. In the case of an archive retrieval
--   job, depending on the byte range you specify, Amazon S3 Glacier
--   (Glacier) returns the checksum for the portion of the data. You can
--   compute the checksum on the client and verify that the values match to
--   ensure the portion you downloaded is the correct data.
--   
--   A job ID will not expire for at least 24 hours after Glacier completes
--   the job. That a byte range. For both archive and inventory retrieval
--   jobs, you should verify the downloaded size against the size returned
--   in the headers from the <b>Get Job Output</b> response.
--   
--   For archive retrieval jobs, you should also verify that the size is
--   what you expected. If you download a portion of the output, the
--   expected size is based on the range of bytes you specified. For
--   example, if you specify a range of <tt>bytes=0-1048575</tt>, you
--   should verify your download size is 1,048,576 bytes. If you download
--   an entire archive, the expected size is the size of the archive when
--   you uploaded it to Amazon S3 Glacier The expected size is also
--   returned in the headers from the __Get Job Output__ response.
--   
--   In the case of an archive retrieval job, depending on the byte range
--   you specify, Glacier returns the checksum for the portion of the data.
--   To ensure the portion you downloaded is the correct data, compute the
--   checksum on the client, verify that the values match, and verify that
--   the size is what you expected.
--   
--   A job ID does not expire for at least 24 hours after Glacier completes
--   the job. That is, you can download the job output within the 24 hours
--   period after Amazon Glacier completes the job.
--   
--   An AWS account has full permission to perform all operations
--   (actions). However, AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) users
--   don't have any permissions by default. You must grant them explicit
--   permission to perform specific actions. For more information, see
--   <a>Access Control Using AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM)</a>.
--   
--   For conceptual information and the underlying REST API, see
--   <a>Downloading a Vault Inventory</a>, <a>Downloading an Archive</a>,
--   and <a>Get Job Output</a>
module Network.AWS.Glacier.GetJobOutput

-- | Provides options for downloading output of an Amazon S3 Glacier job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetJobOutput</a> smart constructor.
data GetJobOutput
GetJobOutput' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> GetJobOutput

-- | The range of bytes to retrieve from the output. For example, if you
--   want to download the first 1,048,576 bytes, specify the range as
--   <tt>bytes=0-1048575</tt>. By default, this operation downloads the
--   entire output.
--   
--   If the job output is large, then you can use a range to retrieve a
--   portion of the output. This allows you to download the entire output
--   in smaller chunks of bytes. For example, suppose you have 1 GB of job
--   output you want to download and you decide to download 128 MB chunks
--   of data at a time, which is a total of eight Get Job Output requests.
--   You use the following process to download the job output:
--   
--   <ol>
--   <li>Download a 128 MB chunk of output by specifying the appropriate
--   byte range. Verify that all 128 MB of data was received.</li>
--   <li>Along with the data, the response includes a SHA256 tree hash of
--   the payload. You compute the checksum of the payload on the client and
--   compare it with the checksum you received in the response to ensure
--   you received all the expected data.</li>
--   <li>Repeat steps 1 and 2 for all the eight 128 MB chunks of output
--   data, each time specifying the appropriate byte range.</li>
--   <li>After downloading all the parts of the job output, you have a list
--   of eight checksum values. Compute the tree hash of these values to
--   find the checksum of the entire output. Using the DescribeJob API,
--   obtain job information of the job that provided you the output. The
--   response includes the checksum of the entire archive stored in Amazon
--   S3 Glacier. You compare this value with the checksum you computed to
--   ensure you have downloaded the entire archive content with no
--   errors.</li>
--   </ol>
[$sel:range:GetJobOutput'] :: GetJobOutput -> Maybe Text

-- | The <tt>AccountId</tt> value is the AWS account ID of the account that
--   owns the vault. You can either specify an AWS account ID or optionally
--   a single '<tt>-</tt>' (hyphen), in which case Amazon S3 Glacier uses
--   the AWS account ID associated with the credentials used to sign the
--   request. If you use an account ID, do not include any hyphens ('-') in
--   the ID.
[$sel:accountId:GetJobOutput'] :: GetJobOutput -> Text

-- | The name of the vault.
[$sel:vaultName:GetJobOutput'] :: GetJobOutput -> Text

-- | The job ID whose data is downloaded.
[$sel:jobId:GetJobOutput'] :: GetJobOutput -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GetJobOutput</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:range:GetJobOutput'</a>, <a>getJobOutput_range</a> - The range
--   of bytes to retrieve from the output. For example, if you want to
--   download the first 1,048,576 bytes, specify the range as
--   <tt>bytes=0-1048575</tt>. By default, this operation downloads the
--   entire output.
--   
--   If the job output is large, then you can use a range to retrieve a
--   portion of the output. This allows you to download the entire output
--   in smaller chunks of bytes. For example, suppose you have 1 GB of job
--   output you want to download and you decide to download 128 MB chunks
--   of data at a time, which is a total of eight Get Job Output requests.
--   You use the following process to download the job output:
--   
--   <ol>
--   <li>Download a 128 MB chunk of output by specifying the appropriate
--   byte range. Verify that all 128 MB of data was received.</li>
--   <li>Along with the data, the response includes a SHA256 tree hash of
--   the payload. You compute the checksum of the payload on the client and
--   compare it with the checksum you received in the response to ensure
--   you received all the expected data.</li>
--   <li>Repeat steps 1 and 2 for all the eight 128 MB chunks of output
--   data, each time specifying the appropriate byte range.</li>
--   <li>After downloading all the parts of the job output, you have a list
--   of eight checksum values. Compute the tree hash of these values to
--   find the checksum of the entire output. Using the DescribeJob API,
--   obtain job information of the job that provided you the output. The
--   response includes the checksum of the entire archive stored in Amazon
--   S3 Glacier. You compare this value with the checksum you computed to
--   ensure you have downloaded the entire archive content with no
--   errors.</li>
--   </ol>
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:GetJobOutput'</a>, <a>getJobOutput_accountId</a> -
--   The <tt>AccountId</tt> value is the AWS account ID of the account that
--   owns the vault. You can either specify an AWS account ID or optionally
--   a single '<tt>-</tt>' (hyphen), in which case Amazon S3 Glacier uses
--   the AWS account ID associated with the credentials used to sign the
--   request. If you use an account ID, do not include any hyphens ('-') in
--   the ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vaultName:GetJobOutput'</a>, <a>getJobOutput_vaultName</a> -
--   The name of the vault.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobId:GetJobOutput'</a>, <a>getJobOutput_jobId</a> - The job
--   ID whose data is downloaded.
newGetJobOutput :: Text -> Text -> Text -> GetJobOutput

-- | The range of bytes to retrieve from the output. For example, if you
--   want to download the first 1,048,576 bytes, specify the range as
--   <tt>bytes=0-1048575</tt>. By default, this operation downloads the
--   entire output.
--   
--   If the job output is large, then you can use a range to retrieve a
--   portion of the output. This allows you to download the entire output
--   in smaller chunks of bytes. For example, suppose you have 1 GB of job
--   output you want to download and you decide to download 128 MB chunks
--   of data at a time, which is a total of eight Get Job Output requests.
--   You use the following process to download the job output:
--   
--   <ol>
--   <li>Download a 128 MB chunk of output by specifying the appropriate
--   byte range. Verify that all 128 MB of data was received.</li>
--   <li>Along with the data, the response includes a SHA256 tree hash of
--   the payload. You compute the checksum of the payload on the client and
--   compare it with the checksum you received in the response to ensure
--   you received all the expected data.</li>
--   <li>Repeat steps 1 and 2 for all the eight 128 MB chunks of output
--   data, each time specifying the appropriate byte range.</li>
--   <li>After downloading all the parts of the job output, you have a list
--   of eight checksum values. Compute the tree hash of these values to
--   find the checksum of the entire output. Using the DescribeJob API,
--   obtain job information of the job that provided you the output. The
--   response includes the checksum of the entire archive stored in Amazon
--   S3 Glacier. You compare this value with the checksum you computed to
--   ensure you have downloaded the entire archive content with no
--   errors.</li>
--   </ol>
getJobOutput_range :: Lens' GetJobOutput (Maybe Text)

-- | The <tt>AccountId</tt> value is the AWS account ID of the account that
--   owns the vault. You can either specify an AWS account ID or optionally
--   a single '<tt>-</tt>' (hyphen), in which case Amazon S3 Glacier uses
--   the AWS account ID associated with the credentials used to sign the
--   request. If you use an account ID, do not include any hyphens ('-') in
--   the ID.
getJobOutput_accountId :: Lens' GetJobOutput Text

-- | The name of the vault.
getJobOutput_vaultName :: Lens' GetJobOutput Text

-- | The job ID whose data is downloaded.
getJobOutput_jobId :: Lens' GetJobOutput Text

-- | Contains the Amazon S3 Glacier response to your request.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetJobOutputResponse</a> smart constructor.
data GetJobOutputResponse
GetJobOutputResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Int -> ResponseBody -> GetJobOutputResponse

-- | The Content-Type depends on whether the job output is an archive or a
--   vault inventory. For archive data, the Content-Type is
--   application/octet-stream. For vault inventory, if you requested CSV
--   format when you initiated the job, the Content-Type is text/csv.
--   Otherwise, by default, vault inventory is returned as JSON, and the
--   Content-Type is application/json.
[$sel:contentType:GetJobOutputResponse'] :: GetJobOutputResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The range of bytes returned by Amazon S3 Glacier. If only partial
--   output is downloaded, the response provides the range of bytes Amazon
--   S3 Glacier returned. For example, bytes 0-1048575/8388608 returns the
--   first 1 MB from 8 MB.
[$sel:contentRange:GetJobOutputResponse'] :: GetJobOutputResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Indicates the range units accepted. For more information, see
--   <a>RFC2616</a>.
[$sel:acceptRanges:GetJobOutputResponse'] :: GetJobOutputResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The description of an archive.
[$sel:archiveDescription:GetJobOutputResponse'] :: GetJobOutputResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The checksum of the data in the response. This header is returned only
--   when retrieving the output for an archive retrieval job. Furthermore,
--   this header appears only under the following conditions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>You get the entire range of the archive.</li>
--   <li>You request a range to return of the archive that starts and ends
--   on a multiple of 1 MB. For example, if you have an 3.1 MB archive and
--   you specify a range to return that starts at 1 MB and ends at 2 MB,
--   then the x-amz-sha256-tree-hash is returned as a response header.</li>
--   <li>You request a range of the archive to return that starts on a
--   multiple of 1 MB and goes to the end of the archive. For example, if
--   you have a 3.1 MB archive and you specify a range that starts at 2 MB
--   and ends at 3.1 MB (the end of the archive), then the
--   x-amz-sha256-tree-hash is returned as a response header.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:checksum:GetJobOutputResponse'] :: GetJobOutputResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The HTTP response code for a job output request. The value depends on
--   whether a range was specified in the request.
[$sel:status:GetJobOutputResponse'] :: GetJobOutputResponse -> Int

-- | The job data, either archive data or inventory data.
[$sel:body:GetJobOutputResponse'] :: GetJobOutputResponse -> ResponseBody

-- | Create a value of <a>GetJobOutputResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentType:GetJobOutputResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getJobOutputResponse_contentType</a> - The Content-Type depends on
--   whether the job output is an archive or a vault inventory. For archive
--   data, the Content-Type is application/octet-stream. For vault
--   inventory, if you requested CSV format when you initiated the job, the
--   Content-Type is text/csv. Otherwise, by default, vault inventory is
--   returned as JSON, and the Content-Type is application/json.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentRange:GetJobOutputResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getJobOutputResponse_contentRange</a> - The range of bytes returned
--   by Amazon S3 Glacier. If only partial output is downloaded, the
--   response provides the range of bytes Amazon S3 Glacier returned. For
--   example, bytes 0-1048575/8388608 returns the first 1 MB from 8 MB.
--   
--   <a>$sel:acceptRanges:GetJobOutputResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getJobOutputResponse_acceptRanges</a> - Indicates the range units
--   accepted. For more information, see <a>RFC2616</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:archiveDescription:GetJobOutputResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getJobOutputResponse_archiveDescription</a> - The description of an
--   archive.
--   
--   <a>$sel:checksum:GetJobOutputResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getJobOutputResponse_checksum</a> - The checksum of the data in the
--   response. This header is returned only when retrieving the output for
--   an archive retrieval job. Furthermore, this header appears only under
--   the following conditions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>You get the entire range of the archive.</li>
--   <li>You request a range to return of the archive that starts and ends
--   on a multiple of 1 MB. For example, if you have an 3.1 MB archive and
--   you specify a range to return that starts at 1 MB and ends at 2 MB,
--   then the x-amz-sha256-tree-hash is returned as a response header.</li>
--   <li>You request a range of the archive to return that starts on a
--   multiple of 1 MB and goes to the end of the archive. For example, if
--   you have a 3.1 MB archive and you specify a range that starts at 2 MB
--   and ends at 3.1 MB (the end of the archive), then the
--   x-amz-sha256-tree-hash is returned as a response header.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:GetJobOutputResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getJobOutputResponse_status</a> - The HTTP response code for a job
--   output request. The value depends on whether a range was specified in
--   the request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:GetJobOutputResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getJobOutputResponse_body</a> - The job data, either archive data
--   or inventory data.
newGetJobOutputResponse :: Int -> ResponseBody -> GetJobOutputResponse

-- | The Content-Type depends on whether the job output is an archive or a
--   vault inventory. For archive data, the Content-Type is
--   application/octet-stream. For vault inventory, if you requested CSV
--   format when you initiated the job, the Content-Type is text/csv.
--   Otherwise, by default, vault inventory is returned as JSON, and the
--   Content-Type is application/json.
getJobOutputResponse_contentType :: Lens' GetJobOutputResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The range of bytes returned by Amazon S3 Glacier. If only partial
--   output is downloaded, the response provides the range of bytes Amazon
--   S3 Glacier returned. For example, bytes 0-1048575/8388608 returns the
--   first 1 MB from 8 MB.
getJobOutputResponse_contentRange :: Lens' GetJobOutputResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates the range units accepted. For more information, see
--   <a>RFC2616</a>.
getJobOutputResponse_acceptRanges :: Lens' GetJobOutputResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The description of an archive.
getJobOutputResponse_archiveDescription :: Lens' GetJobOutputResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The checksum of the data in the response. This header is returned only
--   when retrieving the output for an archive retrieval job. Furthermore,
--   this header appears only under the following conditions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>You get the entire range of the archive.</li>
--   <li>You request a range to return of the archive that starts and ends
--   on a multiple of 1 MB. For example, if you have an 3.1 MB archive and
--   you specify a range to return that starts at 1 MB and ends at 2 MB,
--   then the x-amz-sha256-tree-hash is returned as a response header.</li>
--   <li>You request a range of the archive to return that starts on a
--   multiple of 1 MB and goes to the end of the archive. For example, if
--   you have a 3.1 MB archive and you specify a range that starts at 2 MB
--   and ends at 3.1 MB (the end of the archive), then the
--   x-amz-sha256-tree-hash is returned as a response header.</li>
--   </ul>
getJobOutputResponse_checksum :: Lens' GetJobOutputResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The HTTP response code for a job output request. The value depends on
--   whether a range was specified in the request.
getJobOutputResponse_status :: Lens' GetJobOutputResponse Int

-- | The job data, either archive data or inventory data.
getJobOutputResponse_body :: Lens' GetJobOutputResponse ResponseBody
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Glacier.GetJobOutput.GetJobOutput
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Glacier.GetJobOutput.GetJobOutput
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Glacier.GetJobOutput.GetJobOutput
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Glacier.GetJobOutput.GetJobOutput
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Glacier.GetJobOutput.GetJobOutputResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Glacier.GetJobOutput.GetJobOutputResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.Glacier.GetJobOutput.GetJobOutput
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Glacier.GetJobOutput.GetJobOutput
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Glacier.GetJobOutput.GetJobOutput
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.Glacier.GetJobOutput.GetJobOutput
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.Glacier.GetJobOutput.GetJobOutput
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Glacier.GetJobOutput.GetJobOutput


-- | This operation returns the current data retrieval policy for the
--   account and region specified in the GET request. For more information
--   about data retrieval policies, see <a>Amazon Glacier Data Retrieval
--   Policies</a>.
module Network.AWS.Glacier.GetDataRetrievalPolicy

-- | Input for GetDataRetrievalPolicy.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetDataRetrievalPolicy</a> smart constructor.
data GetDataRetrievalPolicy
GetDataRetrievalPolicy' :: Text -> GetDataRetrievalPolicy

-- | The <tt>AccountId</tt> value is the AWS account ID. This value must
--   match the AWS account ID associated with the credentials used to sign
--   the request. You can either specify an AWS account ID or optionally a
--   single '<tt>-</tt>' (hyphen), in which case Amazon Glacier uses the
--   AWS account ID associated with the credentials used to sign the
--   request. If you specify your account ID, do not include any hyphens
--   ('-') in the ID.
[$sel:accountId:GetDataRetrievalPolicy'] :: GetDataRetrievalPolicy -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GetDataRetrievalPolicy</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:GetDataRetrievalPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>getDataRetrievalPolicy_accountId</a> - The <tt>AccountId</tt> value
--   is the AWS account ID. This value must match the AWS account ID
--   associated with the credentials used to sign the request. You can
--   either specify an AWS account ID or optionally a single '<tt>-</tt>'
--   (hyphen), in which case Amazon Glacier uses the AWS account ID
--   associated with the credentials used to sign the request. If you
--   specify your account ID, do not include any hyphens ('-') in the ID.
newGetDataRetrievalPolicy :: Text -> GetDataRetrievalPolicy

-- | The <tt>AccountId</tt> value is the AWS account ID. This value must
--   match the AWS account ID associated with the credentials used to sign
--   the request. You can either specify an AWS account ID or optionally a
--   single '<tt>-</tt>' (hyphen), in which case Amazon Glacier uses the
--   AWS account ID associated with the credentials used to sign the
--   request. If you specify your account ID, do not include any hyphens
--   ('-') in the ID.
getDataRetrievalPolicy_accountId :: Lens' GetDataRetrievalPolicy Text

-- | Contains the Amazon S3 Glacier response to the
--   <tt>GetDataRetrievalPolicy</tt> request.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetDataRetrievalPolicyResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data GetDataRetrievalPolicyResponse

-- | This operation returns information about a vault, including the
--   vault's Amazon Resource Name (ARN), the date the vault was created,
--   the number of archives it contains, and the total size of all the
--   archives in the vault. The number of archives and their total size are
--   as of the last inventory generation. This means that if you add or
--   remove an archive from a vault, and then immediately use Describe
--   Vault, the change in contents will not be immediately reflected. If
--   you want to retrieve the latest inventory of the vault, use
--   InitiateJob. Amazon S3 Glacier generates vault inventories
--   approximately daily. For more information, see <a>Downloading a Vault
--   Inventory in Amazon S3 Glacier</a>.
--   
--   An AWS account has full permission to perform all operations
--   (actions). However, AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) users
--   don't have any permissions by default. You must grant them explicit
--   permission to perform specific actions. For more information, see
--   <a>Access Control Using AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM)</a>.
--   
--   For conceptual information and underlying REST API, see <a>Retrieving
--   Vault Metadata in Amazon S3 Glacier</a> and <a>Describe Vault</a> in
--   the <i>Amazon Glacier Developer Guide</i>.
module Network.AWS.Glacier.DescribeVault

-- | Provides options for retrieving metadata for a specific vault in
--   Amazon Glacier.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeVault</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeVault
DescribeVault' :: Text -> Text -> DescribeVault

-- | The <tt>AccountId</tt> value is the AWS account ID of the account that
--   owns the vault. You can either specify an AWS account ID or optionally
--   a single '<tt>-</tt>' (hyphen), in which case Amazon S3 Glacier uses
--   the AWS account ID associated with the credentials used to sign the
--   request. If you use an account ID, do not include any hyphens ('-') in
--   the ID.
[$sel:accountId:DescribeVault'] :: DescribeVault -> Text

-- | The name of the vault.
[$sel:vaultName:DescribeVault'] :: DescribeVault -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeVault</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:DescribeVault'</a>, <a>describeVault_accountId</a> -
--   The <tt>AccountId</tt> value is the AWS account ID of the account that
--   owns the vault. You can either specify an AWS account ID or optionally
--   a single '<tt>-</tt>' (hyphen), in which case Amazon S3 Glacier uses
--   the AWS account ID associated with the credentials used to sign the
--   request. If you use an account ID, do not include any hyphens ('-') in
--   the ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vaultName:DescribeVault'</a>, <a>describeVault_vaultName</a> -
--   The name of the vault.
newDescribeVault :: Text -> Text -> DescribeVault

-- | The <tt>AccountId</tt> value is the AWS account ID of the account that
--   owns the vault. You can either specify an AWS account ID or optionally
--   a single '<tt>-</tt>' (hyphen), in which case Amazon S3 Glacier uses
--   the AWS account ID associated with the credentials used to sign the
--   request. If you use an account ID, do not include any hyphens ('-') in
--   the ID.
describeVault_accountId :: Lens' DescribeVault Text

-- | The name of the vault.
describeVault_vaultName :: Lens' DescribeVault Text

-- | Contains the Amazon S3 Glacier response to your request.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeVaultOutput</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeVaultOutput
DescribeVaultOutput' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> DescribeVaultOutput

-- | The Universal Coordinated Time (UTC) date when Amazon S3 Glacier
--   completed the last vault inventory. This value should be a string in
--   the ISO 8601 date format, for example
--   <tt>2012-03-20T17:03:43.221Z</tt>.
[$sel:lastInventoryDate:DescribeVaultOutput'] :: DescribeVaultOutput -> Maybe Text

-- | The Universal Coordinated Time (UTC) date when the vault was created.
--   This value should be a string in the ISO 8601 date format, for example
--   <tt>2012-03-20T17:03:43.221Z</tt>.
[$sel:creationDate:DescribeVaultOutput'] :: DescribeVaultOutput -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the vault.
[$sel:vaultName:DescribeVaultOutput'] :: DescribeVaultOutput -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the vault.
[$sel:vaultARN:DescribeVaultOutput'] :: DescribeVaultOutput -> Maybe Text

-- | Total size, in bytes, of the archives in the vault as of the last
--   inventory date. This field will return null if an inventory has not
--   yet run on the vault, for example if you just created the vault.
[$sel:sizeInBytes:DescribeVaultOutput'] :: DescribeVaultOutput -> Maybe Integer

-- | The number of archives in the vault as of the last inventory date.
--   This field will return <tt>null</tt> if an inventory has not yet run
--   on the vault, for example if you just created the vault.
[$sel:numberOfArchives:DescribeVaultOutput'] :: DescribeVaultOutput -> Maybe Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeVaultOutput</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastInventoryDate:DescribeVaultOutput'</a>,
--   <a>describeVaultOutput_lastInventoryDate</a> - The Universal
--   Coordinated Time (UTC) date when Amazon S3 Glacier completed the last
--   vault inventory. This value should be a string in the ISO 8601 date
--   format, for example <tt>2012-03-20T17:03:43.221Z</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:DescribeVaultOutput'</a>,
--   <a>describeVaultOutput_creationDate</a> - The Universal Coordinated
--   Time (UTC) date when the vault was created. This value should be a
--   string in the ISO 8601 date format, for example
--   <tt>2012-03-20T17:03:43.221Z</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vaultName:DescribeVaultOutput'</a>,
--   <a>describeVaultOutput_vaultName</a> - The name of the vault.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vaultARN:DescribeVaultOutput'</a>,
--   <a>describeVaultOutput_vaultARN</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the vault.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sizeInBytes:DescribeVaultOutput'</a>,
--   <a>describeVaultOutput_sizeInBytes</a> - Total size, in bytes, of the
--   archives in the vault as of the last inventory date. This field will
--   return null if an inventory has not yet run on the vault, for example
--   if you just created the vault.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfArchives:DescribeVaultOutput'</a>,
--   <a>describeVaultOutput_numberOfArchives</a> - The number of archives
--   in the vault as of the last inventory date. This field will return
--   <tt>null</tt> if an inventory has not yet run on the vault, for
--   example if you just created the vault.
newDescribeVaultOutput :: DescribeVaultOutput

-- | The Universal Coordinated Time (UTC) date when Amazon S3 Glacier
--   completed the last vault inventory. This value should be a string in
--   the ISO 8601 date format, for example
--   <tt>2012-03-20T17:03:43.221Z</tt>.
describeVaultOutput_lastInventoryDate :: Lens' DescribeVaultOutput (Maybe Text)

-- | The Universal Coordinated Time (UTC) date when the vault was created.
--   This value should be a string in the ISO 8601 date format, for example
--   <tt>2012-03-20T17:03:43.221Z</tt>.
describeVaultOutput_creationDate :: Lens' DescribeVaultOutput (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the vault.
describeVaultOutput_vaultName :: Lens' DescribeVaultOutput (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the vault.
describeVaultOutput_vaultARN :: Lens' DescribeVaultOutput (Maybe Text)

-- | Total size, in bytes, of the archives in the vault as of the last
--   inventory date. This field will return null if an inventory has not
--   yet run on the vault, for example if you just created the vault.
describeVaultOutput_sizeInBytes :: Lens' DescribeVaultOutput (Maybe Integer)

-- | The number of archives in the vault as of the last inventory date.
--   This field will return <tt>null</tt> if an inventory has not yet run
--   on the vault, for example if you just created the vault.
describeVaultOutput_numberOfArchives :: Lens' DescribeVaultOutput (Maybe Integer)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Glacier.DescribeVault.DescribeVault
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Glacier.DescribeVault.DescribeVault
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Glacier.DescribeVault.DescribeVault
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Glacier.DescribeVault.DescribeVault

instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Glacier.DescribeVault.DescribeVault


-- | This operation returns information about a job you previously
--   initiated, including the job initiation date, the user who initiated
--   the job, the job status code/message and the Amazon SNS topic to
--   notify after Amazon S3 Glacier (Glacier) completes the job. For more
--   information about initiating a job, see InitiateJob.
--   
--   This operation enables you to check the status of your job. However,
--   it is strongly recommended that you set up an Amazon SNS topic and
--   specify it in your initiate job request so that Glacier can notify the
--   topic after it completes the job.
--   
--   A job ID will not expire for at least 24 hours after Glacier completes
--   the job.
--   
--   An AWS account has full permission to perform all operations
--   (actions). However, AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) users
--   don't have any permissions by default. You must grant them explicit
--   permission to perform specific actions. For more information, see
--   <a>Access Control Using AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM)</a>.
--   
--   For more information about using this operation, see the documentation
--   for the underlying REST API <a>Describe Job</a> in the <i>Amazon
--   Glacier Developer Guide</i>.
module Network.AWS.Glacier.DescribeJob

-- | Provides options for retrieving a job description.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeJob</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeJob
DescribeJob' :: Text -> Text -> Text -> DescribeJob

-- | The <tt>AccountId</tt> value is the AWS account ID of the account that
--   owns the vault. You can either specify an AWS account ID or optionally
--   a single '<tt>-</tt>' (hyphen), in which case Amazon S3 Glacier uses
--   the AWS account ID associated with the credentials used to sign the
--   request. If you use an account ID, do not include any hyphens ('-') in
--   the ID.
[$sel:accountId:DescribeJob'] :: DescribeJob -> Text

-- | The name of the vault.
[$sel:vaultName:DescribeJob'] :: DescribeJob -> Text

-- | The ID of the job to describe.
[$sel:jobId:DescribeJob'] :: DescribeJob -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeJob</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:DescribeJob'</a>, <a>describeJob_accountId</a> - The
--   <tt>AccountId</tt> value is the AWS account ID of the account that
--   owns the vault. You can either specify an AWS account ID or optionally
--   a single '<tt>-</tt>' (hyphen), in which case Amazon S3 Glacier uses
--   the AWS account ID associated with the credentials used to sign the
--   request. If you use an account ID, do not include any hyphens ('-') in
--   the ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vaultName:DescribeJob'</a>, <a>describeJob_vaultName</a> - The
--   name of the vault.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobId:DescribeJob'</a>, <a>describeJob_jobId</a> - The ID of
--   the job to describe.
newDescribeJob :: Text -> Text -> Text -> DescribeJob

-- | The <tt>AccountId</tt> value is the AWS account ID of the account that
--   owns the vault. You can either specify an AWS account ID or optionally
--   a single '<tt>-</tt>' (hyphen), in which case Amazon S3 Glacier uses
--   the AWS account ID associated with the credentials used to sign the
--   request. If you use an account ID, do not include any hyphens ('-') in
--   the ID.
describeJob_accountId :: Lens' DescribeJob Text

-- | The name of the vault.
describeJob_vaultName :: Lens' DescribeJob Text

-- | The ID of the job to describe.
describeJob_jobId :: Lens' DescribeJob Text

-- | Contains the description of an Amazon S3 Glacier job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGlacierJobDescription</a> smart constructor.
data GlacierJobDescription
GlacierJobDescription' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe SelectParameters -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe StatusCode -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe ActionCode -> Maybe InventoryRetrievalJobDescription -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe OutputLocation -> GlacierJobDescription

-- | For an archive retrieval job, this value is the checksum of the
--   archive. Otherwise, this value is null.
--   
--   The SHA256 tree hash value for the requested range of an archive. If
--   the <b>InitiateJob</b> request for an archive specified a tree-hash
--   aligned range, then this field returns a value.
--   
--   If the whole archive is retrieved, this value is the same as the
--   ArchiveSHA256TreeHash value.
--   
--   This field is null for the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Archive retrieval jobs that specify a range that is not tree-hash
--   aligned</li>
--   <li>Archival jobs that specify a range that is equal to the whole
--   archive, when the job status is <tt>InProgress</tt></li>
--   <li>Inventory jobs</li>
--   <li>Select jobs</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:sHA256TreeHash:GlacierJobDescription'] :: GlacierJobDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | A friendly message that describes the job status.
[$sel:statusMessage:GlacierJobDescription'] :: GlacierJobDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The job description provided when initiating the job.
[$sel:jobDescription:GlacierJobDescription'] :: GlacierJobDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The retrieved byte range for archive retrieval jobs in the form
--   <i>StartByteValue</i>-<i>EndByteValue</i>. If no range was specified
--   in the archive retrieval, then the whole archive is retrieved. In this
--   case, <i>StartByteValue</i> equals 0 and <i>EndByteValue</i> equals
--   the size of the archive minus 1. For inventory retrieval or select
--   jobs, this field is null.
[$sel:retrievalByteRange:GlacierJobDescription'] :: GlacierJobDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | Contains the job output location.
[$sel:jobOutputPath:GlacierJobDescription'] :: GlacierJobDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The UTC date when the job was created. This value is a string
--   representation of ISO 8601 date format, for example
--   <tt>"2012-03-20T17:03:43.221Z"</tt>.
[$sel:creationDate:GlacierJobDescription'] :: GlacierJobDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | Contains the parameters used for a select.
[$sel:selectParameters:GlacierJobDescription'] :: GlacierJobDescription -> Maybe SelectParameters

-- | An Amazon SNS topic that receives notification.
[$sel:sNSTopic:GlacierJobDescription'] :: GlacierJobDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the vault from which an archive
--   retrieval was requested.
[$sel:vaultARN:GlacierJobDescription'] :: GlacierJobDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The archive ID requested for a select job or archive retrieval.
--   Otherwise, this field is null.
[$sel:archiveId:GlacierJobDescription'] :: GlacierJobDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The status code can be <tt>InProgress</tt>, <tt>Succeeded</tt>, or
--   <tt>Failed</tt>, and indicates the status of the job.
[$sel:statusCode:GlacierJobDescription'] :: GlacierJobDescription -> Maybe StatusCode

-- | For an inventory retrieval job, this value is the size in bytes of the
--   inventory requested for download. For an archive retrieval or select
--   job, this value is null.
[$sel:inventorySizeInBytes:GlacierJobDescription'] :: GlacierJobDescription -> Maybe Integer

-- | For an archive retrieval job, this value is the size in bytes of the
--   archive being requested for download. For an inventory retrieval or
--   select job, this value is null.
[$sel:archiveSizeInBytes:GlacierJobDescription'] :: GlacierJobDescription -> Maybe Integer

-- | The job type. This value is either <tt>ArchiveRetrieval</tt>,
--   <tt>InventoryRetrieval</tt>, or <tt>Select</tt>.
[$sel:action:GlacierJobDescription'] :: GlacierJobDescription -> Maybe ActionCode

-- | Parameters used for range inventory retrieval.
[$sel:inventoryRetrievalParameters:GlacierJobDescription'] :: GlacierJobDescription -> Maybe InventoryRetrievalJobDescription

-- | The UTC time that the job request completed. While the job is in
--   progress, the value is null.
[$sel:completionDate:GlacierJobDescription'] :: GlacierJobDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The job status. When a job is completed, you get the job's output
--   using Get Job Output (GET output).
[$sel:completed:GlacierJobDescription'] :: GlacierJobDescription -> Maybe Bool

-- | The SHA256 tree hash of the entire archive for an archive retrieval.
--   For inventory retrieval or select jobs, this field is null.
[$sel:archiveSHA256TreeHash:GlacierJobDescription'] :: GlacierJobDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | The tier to use for a select or an archive retrieval. Valid values are
--   <tt>Expedited</tt>, <tt>Standard</tt>, or <tt>Bulk</tt>.
--   <tt>Standard</tt> is the default.
[$sel:tier:GlacierJobDescription'] :: GlacierJobDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | An opaque string that identifies an Amazon S3 Glacier job.
[$sel:jobId:GlacierJobDescription'] :: GlacierJobDescription -> Maybe Text

-- | Contains the location where the data from the select job is stored.
[$sel:outputLocation:GlacierJobDescription'] :: GlacierJobDescription -> Maybe OutputLocation

-- | Create a value of <a>GlacierJobDescription</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sHA256TreeHash:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_sHA256TreeHash</a> - For an archive retrieval
--   job, this value is the checksum of the archive. Otherwise, this value
--   is null.
--   
--   The SHA256 tree hash value for the requested range of an archive. If
--   the <b>InitiateJob</b> request for an archive specified a tree-hash
--   aligned range, then this field returns a value.
--   
--   If the whole archive is retrieved, this value is the same as the
--   ArchiveSHA256TreeHash value.
--   
--   This field is null for the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Archive retrieval jobs that specify a range that is not tree-hash
--   aligned</li>
--   <li>Archival jobs that specify a range that is equal to the whole
--   archive, when the job status is <tt>InProgress</tt></li>
--   <li>Inventory jobs</li>
--   <li>Select jobs</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusMessage:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_statusMessage</a> - A friendly message that
--   describes the job status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobDescription:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_jobDescription</a> - The job description
--   provided when initiating the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:retrievalByteRange:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_retrievalByteRange</a> - The retrieved byte
--   range for archive retrieval jobs in the form
--   <i>StartByteValue</i>-<i>EndByteValue</i>. If no range was specified
--   in the archive retrieval, then the whole archive is retrieved. In this
--   case, <i>StartByteValue</i> equals 0 and <i>EndByteValue</i> equals
--   the size of the archive minus 1. For inventory retrieval or select
--   jobs, this field is null.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobOutputPath:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_jobOutputPath</a> - Contains the job output
--   location.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_creationDate</a> - The UTC date when the job
--   was created. This value is a string representation of ISO 8601 date
--   format, for example <tt>"2012-03-20T17:03:43.221Z"</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:selectParameters:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_selectParameters</a> - Contains the
--   parameters used for a select.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sNSTopic:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_sNSTopic</a> - An Amazon SNS topic that
--   receives notification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vaultARN:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_vaultARN</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the vault from which an archive retrieval was requested.
--   
--   <a>$sel:archiveId:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_archiveId</a> - The archive ID requested for
--   a select job or archive retrieval. Otherwise, this field is null.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusCode:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_statusCode</a> - The status code can be
--   <tt>InProgress</tt>, <tt>Succeeded</tt>, or <tt>Failed</tt>, and
--   indicates the status of the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inventorySizeInBytes:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_inventorySizeInBytes</a> - For an inventory
--   retrieval job, this value is the size in bytes of the inventory
--   requested for download. For an archive retrieval or select job, this
--   value is null.
--   
--   <a>$sel:archiveSizeInBytes:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_archiveSizeInBytes</a> - For an archive
--   retrieval job, this value is the size in bytes of the archive being
--   requested for download. For an inventory retrieval or select job, this
--   value is null.
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_action</a> - The job type. This value is
--   either <tt>ArchiveRetrieval</tt>, <tt>InventoryRetrieval</tt>, or
--   <tt>Select</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inventoryRetrievalParameters:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_inventoryRetrievalParameters</a> - Parameters
--   used for range inventory retrieval.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completionDate:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_completionDate</a> - The UTC time that the
--   job request completed. While the job is in progress, the value is
--   null.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completed:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_completed</a> - The job status. When a job is
--   completed, you get the job's output using Get Job Output (GET output).
--   
--   <a>$sel:archiveSHA256TreeHash:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_archiveSHA256TreeHash</a> - The SHA256 tree
--   hash of the entire archive for an archive retrieval. For inventory
--   retrieval or select jobs, this field is null.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tier:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_tier</a> - The tier to use for a select or an
--   archive retrieval. Valid values are <tt>Expedited</tt>,
--   <tt>Standard</tt>, or <tt>Bulk</tt>. <tt>Standard</tt> is the default.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobId:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_jobId</a> - An opaque string that identifies
--   an Amazon S3 Glacier job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputLocation:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_outputLocation</a> - Contains the location
--   where the data from the select job is stored.
newGlacierJobDescription :: GlacierJobDescription

-- | For an archive retrieval job, this value is the checksum of the
--   archive. Otherwise, this value is null.
--   
--   The SHA256 tree hash value for the requested range of an archive. If
--   the <b>InitiateJob</b> request for an archive specified a tree-hash
--   aligned range, then this field returns a value.
--   
--   If the whole archive is retrieved, this value is the same as the
--   ArchiveSHA256TreeHash value.
--   
--   This field is null for the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Archive retrieval jobs that specify a range that is not tree-hash
--   aligned</li>
--   <li>Archival jobs that specify a range that is equal to the whole
--   archive, when the job status is <tt>InProgress</tt></li>
--   <li>Inventory jobs</li>
--   <li>Select jobs</li>
--   </ul>
glacierJobDescription_sHA256TreeHash :: Lens' GlacierJobDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | A friendly message that describes the job status.
glacierJobDescription_statusMessage :: Lens' GlacierJobDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The job description provided when initiating the job.
glacierJobDescription_jobDescription :: Lens' GlacierJobDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The retrieved byte range for archive retrieval jobs in the form
--   <i>StartByteValue</i>-<i>EndByteValue</i>. If no range was specified
--   in the archive retrieval, then the whole archive is retrieved. In this
--   case, <i>StartByteValue</i> equals 0 and <i>EndByteValue</i> equals
--   the size of the archive minus 1. For inventory retrieval or select
--   jobs, this field is null.
glacierJobDescription_retrievalByteRange :: Lens' GlacierJobDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains the job output location.
glacierJobDescription_jobOutputPath :: Lens' GlacierJobDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The UTC date when the job was created. This value is a string
--   representation of ISO 8601 date format, for example
--   <tt>"2012-03-20T17:03:43.221Z"</tt>.
glacierJobDescription_creationDate :: Lens' GlacierJobDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains the parameters used for a select.
glacierJobDescription_selectParameters :: Lens' GlacierJobDescription (Maybe SelectParameters)

-- | An Amazon SNS topic that receives notification.
glacierJobDescription_sNSTopic :: Lens' GlacierJobDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the vault from which an archive
--   retrieval was requested.
glacierJobDescription_vaultARN :: Lens' GlacierJobDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The archive ID requested for a select job or archive retrieval.
--   Otherwise, this field is null.
glacierJobDescription_archiveId :: Lens' GlacierJobDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The status code can be <tt>InProgress</tt>, <tt>Succeeded</tt>, or
--   <tt>Failed</tt>, and indicates the status of the job.
glacierJobDescription_statusCode :: Lens' GlacierJobDescription (Maybe StatusCode)

-- | For an inventory retrieval job, this value is the size in bytes of the
--   inventory requested for download. For an archive retrieval or select
--   job, this value is null.
glacierJobDescription_inventorySizeInBytes :: Lens' GlacierJobDescription (Maybe Integer)

-- | For an archive retrieval job, this value is the size in bytes of the
--   archive being requested for download. For an inventory retrieval or
--   select job, this value is null.
glacierJobDescription_archiveSizeInBytes :: Lens' GlacierJobDescription (Maybe Integer)

-- | The job type. This value is either <tt>ArchiveRetrieval</tt>,
--   <tt>InventoryRetrieval</tt>, or <tt>Select</tt>.
glacierJobDescription_action :: Lens' GlacierJobDescription (Maybe ActionCode)

-- | Parameters used for range inventory retrieval.
glacierJobDescription_inventoryRetrievalParameters :: Lens' GlacierJobDescription (Maybe InventoryRetrievalJobDescription)

-- | The UTC time that the job request completed. While the job is in
--   progress, the value is null.
glacierJobDescription_completionDate :: Lens' GlacierJobDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The job status. When a job is completed, you get the job's output
--   using Get Job Output (GET output).
glacierJobDescription_completed :: Lens' GlacierJobDescription (Maybe Bool)

-- | The SHA256 tree hash of the entire archive for an archive retrieval.
--   For inventory retrieval or select jobs, this field is null.
glacierJobDescription_archiveSHA256TreeHash :: Lens' GlacierJobDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The tier to use for a select or an archive retrieval. Valid values are
--   <tt>Expedited</tt>, <tt>Standard</tt>, or <tt>Bulk</tt>.
--   <tt>Standard</tt> is the default.
glacierJobDescription_tier :: Lens' GlacierJobDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | An opaque string that identifies an Amazon S3 Glacier job.
glacierJobDescription_jobId :: Lens' GlacierJobDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains the location where the data from the select job is stored.
glacierJobDescription_outputLocation :: Lens' GlacierJobDescription (Maybe OutputLocation)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Glacier.DescribeJob.DescribeJob
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Glacier.DescribeJob.DescribeJob
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Glacier.DescribeJob.DescribeJob
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Glacier.DescribeJob.DescribeJob
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.Glacier.DescribeJob.DescribeJob
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Glacier.DescribeJob.DescribeJob
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Glacier.DescribeJob.DescribeJob

instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.Glacier.DescribeJob.DescribeJob
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Glacier.DescribeJob.DescribeJob


-- | This operation deletes the notification configuration set for a vault.
--   The operation is eventually consistent; that is, it might take some
--   time for Amazon S3 Glacier to completely disable the notifications and
--   you might still receive some notifications for a short time after you
--   send the delete request.
--   
--   An AWS account has full permission to perform all operations
--   (actions). However, AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) users
--   don't have any permissions by default. You must grant them explicit
--   permission to perform specific actions. For more information, see
--   <a>Access Control Using AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM)</a>.
--   
--   For conceptual information and underlying REST API, see <a>Configuring
--   Vault Notifications in Amazon S3 Glacier</a> and <a>Delete Vault
--   Notification Configuration</a> in the Amazon S3 Glacier Developer
--   Guide.
module Network.AWS.Glacier.DeleteVaultNotifications

-- | Provides options for deleting a vault notification configuration from
--   an Amazon Glacier vault.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteVaultNotifications</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteVaultNotifications
DeleteVaultNotifications' :: Text -> Text -> DeleteVaultNotifications

-- | The <tt>AccountId</tt> value is the AWS account ID of the account that
--   owns the vault. You can either specify an AWS account ID or optionally
--   a single '<tt>-</tt>' (hyphen), in which case Amazon S3 Glacier uses
--   the AWS account ID associated with the credentials used to sign the
--   request. If you use an account ID, do not include any hyphens ('-') in
--   the ID.
[$sel:accountId:DeleteVaultNotifications'] :: DeleteVaultNotifications -> Text

-- | The name of the vault.
[$sel:vaultName:DeleteVaultNotifications'] :: DeleteVaultNotifications -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteVaultNotifications</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:DeleteVaultNotifications'</a>,
--   <a>deleteVaultNotifications_accountId</a> - The <tt>AccountId</tt>
--   value is the AWS account ID of the account that owns the vault. You
--   can either specify an AWS account ID or optionally a single
--   '<tt>-</tt>' (hyphen), in which case Amazon S3 Glacier uses the AWS
--   account ID associated with the credentials used to sign the request.
--   If you use an account ID, do not include any hyphens ('-') in the ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vaultName:DeleteVaultNotifications'</a>,
--   <a>deleteVaultNotifications_vaultName</a> - The name of the vault.
newDeleteVaultNotifications :: Text -> Text -> DeleteVaultNotifications

-- | The <tt>AccountId</tt> value is the AWS account ID of the account that
--   owns the vault. You can either specify an AWS account ID or optionally
--   a single '<tt>-</tt>' (hyphen), in which case Amazon S3 Glacier uses
--   the AWS account ID associated with the credentials used to sign the
--   request. If you use an account ID, do not include any hyphens ('-') in
--   the ID.
deleteVaultNotifications_accountId :: Lens' DeleteVaultNotifications Text

-- | The name of the vault.
deleteVaultNotifications_vaultName :: Lens' DeleteVaultNotifications Text

--   constructor.

--   optional fields omitted.

--   fields.
newDeleteVaultNotificationsResponse :: DeleteVaultNotificationsResponse

-- | This operation deletes the access policy associated with the specified
--   vault. The operation is eventually consistent; that is, it might take
--   some time for Amazon S3 Glacier to completely remove the access
--   policy, and you might still see the effect of the policy for a short
--   time after you send the delete request.
--   
--   This operation is idempotent. You can invoke delete multiple times,
--   even if there is no policy associated with the vault. For more
--   information about vault access policies, see <a>Amazon Glacier Access
--   Control with Vault Access Policies</a>.
module Network.AWS.Glacier.DeleteVaultAccessPolicy

-- | DeleteVaultAccessPolicy input.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteVaultAccessPolicy</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteVaultAccessPolicy
DeleteVaultAccessPolicy' :: Text -> Text -> DeleteVaultAccessPolicy

-- | The <tt>AccountId</tt> value is the AWS account ID of the account that
--   owns the vault. You can either specify an AWS account ID or optionally
--   a single '<tt>-</tt>' (hyphen), in which case Amazon S3 Glacier uses
--   the AWS account ID associated with the credentials used to sign the
--   request. If you use an account ID, do not include any hyphens ('-') in
--   the ID.
[$sel:accountId:DeleteVaultAccessPolicy'] :: DeleteVaultAccessPolicy -> Text

-- | The name of the vault.
[$sel:vaultName:DeleteVaultAccessPolicy'] :: DeleteVaultAccessPolicy -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteVaultAccessPolicy</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:DeleteVaultAccessPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>deleteVaultAccessPolicy_accountId</a> - The <tt>AccountId</tt>
--   value is the AWS account ID of the account that owns the vault. You
--   can either specify an AWS account ID or optionally a single
--   '<tt>-</tt>' (hyphen), in which case Amazon S3 Glacier uses the AWS
--   account ID associated with the credentials used to sign the request.
--   If you use an account ID, do not include any hyphens ('-') in the ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vaultName:DeleteVaultAccessPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>deleteVaultAccessPolicy_vaultName</a> - The name of the vault.
newDeleteVaultAccessPolicy :: Text -> Text -> DeleteVaultAccessPolicy

-- | The <tt>AccountId</tt> value is the AWS account ID of the account that
--   owns the vault. You can either specify an AWS account ID or optionally
--   a single '<tt>-</tt>' (hyphen), in which case Amazon S3 Glacier uses

instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Glacier.DeleteVaultAccessPolicy.DeleteVaultAccessPolicy


-- | This operation deletes a vault. Amazon S3 Glacier will delete a vault
--   only if there are no archives in the vault as of the last inventory
--   and there have been no writes to the vault since the last inventory.
--   If either of these conditions is not satisfied, the vault deletion
--   fails (that is, the vault is not removed) and Amazon S3 Glacier
--   returns an error. You can use DescribeVault to return the number of
--   archives in a vault, and you can use <a>Initiate a Job (POST jobs)</a>
--   to initiate a new inventory retrieval for a vault. The inventory
--   contains the archive IDs you use to delete archives using <a>Delete
--   Archive (DELETE archive)</a>.
--   
--   This operation is idempotent.
--   
--   An AWS account has full permission to perform all operations
--   (actions). However, AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) users
--   don't have any permissions by default. You must grant them explicit
--   permission to perform specific actions. For more information, see
--   <a>Access Control Using AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM)</a>.
--   
--   For conceptual information and underlying REST API, see <a>Deleting a
--   Vault in Amazon Glacier</a> and <a>Delete Vault</a> in the <i>Amazon
--   S3 Glacier Developer Guide</i>.
module Network.AWS.Glacier.DeleteVault

-- | Provides options for deleting a vault from Amazon S3 Glacier.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteVault</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteVault
DeleteVault' :: Text -> Text -> DeleteVault

-- | The <tt>AccountId</tt> value is the AWS account ID of the account that
--   owns the vault. You can either specify an AWS account ID or optionally
--   a single '<tt>-</tt>' (hyphen), in which case Amazon S3 Glacier uses
--   the AWS account ID associated with the credentials used to sign the
--   request. If you use an account ID, do not include any hyphens ('-') in
--   the ID.
[$sel:accountId:DeleteVault'] :: DeleteVault -> Text

-- | The name of the vault.
[$sel:vaultName:DeleteVault'] :: DeleteVault -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteVault</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:DeleteVault'</a>, <a>deleteVault_accountId</a> - The
--   <tt>AccountId</tt> value is the AWS account ID of the account that
--   owns the vault. You can either specify an AWS account ID or optionally
--   a single '<tt>-</tt>' (hyphen), in which case Amazon S3 Glacier uses
--   the AWS account ID associated with the credentials used to sign the
--   request. If you use an account ID, do not include any hyphens ('-') in
--   the ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vaultName:DeleteVault'</a>, <a>deleteVault_vaultName</a> - The
--   name of the vault.
newDeleteVault :: Text -> Text -> DeleteVault

-- | The <tt>AccountId</tt> value is the AWS account ID of the account that
--   owns the vault. You can either specify an AWS account ID or optionally
--   a single '<tt>-</tt>' (hyphen), in which case Amazon S3 Glacier uses
--   the AWS account ID associated with the credentials used to sign the
--   request. If you use an account ID, do not include any hyphens ('-') in
--   the ID.
deleteVault_accountId :: Lens' DeleteVault Text

-- | The name of the vault.
deleteVault_vaultName :: Lens' DeleteVault Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteVaultResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteVaultResponse
DeleteVaultResponse' :: DeleteVaultResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteVaultResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newDeleteVaultResponse :: DeleteVaultResponse
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Glacier.DeleteVault.DeleteVault
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Glacier.DeleteVault.DeleteVault
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Glacier.DeleteVault.DeleteVault
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Glacier.DeleteVault.DeleteVault
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Glacier.DeleteVault.DeleteVaultResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Glacier.DeleteVault.DeleteVaultResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Glacier.DeleteVault.DeleteVaultResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Glacier.DeleteVault.DeleteVaultResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.Glacier.DeleteVault.DeleteVault
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Glacier.DeleteVault.DeleteVaultResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Glacier.DeleteVault.DeleteVault
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Glacier.DeleteVault.DeleteVault
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.Glacier.DeleteVault.DeleteVault
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.Glacier.DeleteVault.DeleteVault
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Glacier.DeleteVault.DeleteVault


-- | This operation deletes an archive from a vault. Subsequent requests to
--   initiate a retrieval of this archive will fail. Archive retrievals
--   that are in progress for this archive ID may or may not succeed
--   according to the following scenarios:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If the archive retrieval job is actively preparing the data for
--   download when Amazon S3 Glacier receives the delete archive request,
--   the archival retrieval operation might fail.</li>
--   <li>If the archive retrieval job has successfully prepared the archive
--   for download when Amazon S3 Glacier receives the delete archive
--   request, you will be able to download the output.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   This operation is idempotent. Attempting to delete an already-deleted
--   archive does not result in an error.
--   
--   An AWS account has full permission to perform all operations
--   (actions). However, AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) users
--   don't have any permissions by default. You must grant them explicit
--   permission to perform specific actions. For more information, see
--   <a>Access Control Using AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM)</a>.
--   
--   For conceptual information and underlying REST API, see <a>Deleting an
--   Archive in Amazon Glacier</a> and <a>Delete Archive</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon Glacier Developer Guide</i>.
module Network.AWS.Glacier.DeleteArchive

-- | Provides options for deleting an archive from an Amazon S3 Glacier
--   vault.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteArchive</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteArchive
DeleteArchive' :: Text -> Text -> Text -> DeleteArchive

-- | The <tt>AccountId</tt> value is the AWS account ID of the account that
--   owns the vault. You can either specify an AWS account ID or optionally
--   a single '<tt>-</tt>' (hyphen), in which case Amazon S3 Glacier uses
--   the AWS account ID associated with the credentials used to sign the
--   request. If you use an account ID, do not include any hyphens ('-') in
--   the ID.
[$sel:accountId:DeleteArchive'] :: DeleteArchive -> Text

-- | The name of the vault.
[$sel:vaultName:DeleteArchive'] :: DeleteArchive -> Text

-- | The ID of the archive to delete.
[$sel:archiveId:DeleteArchive'] :: DeleteArchive -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteArchive</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:DeleteArchive'</a>, <a>deleteArchive_accountId</a> -
--   The <tt>AccountId</tt> value is the AWS account ID of the account that
--   owns the vault. You can either specify an AWS account ID or optionally
--   a single '<tt>-</tt>' (hyphen), in which case Amazon S3 Glacier uses
--   the AWS account ID associated with the credentials used to sign the
--   request. If you use an account ID, do not include any hyphens ('-') in
--   the ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vaultName:DeleteArchive'</a>, <a>deleteArchive_vaultName</a> -
--   The name of the vault.
--   
--   <a>$sel:archiveId:DeleteArchive'</a>, <a>deleteArchive_archiveId</a> -
--   The ID of the archive to delete.
newDeleteArchive :: Text -> Text -> Text -> DeleteArchive

-- | The <tt>AccountId</tt> value is the AWS account ID of the account that
--   owns the vault. You can either specify an AWS account ID or optionally
--   a single '<tt>-</tt>' (hyphen), in which case Amazon S3 Glacier uses
--   the AWS account ID associated with the credentials used to sign the
--   request. If you use an account ID, do not include any hyphens ('-') in
--   the ID.
deleteArchive_accountId :: Lens' DeleteArchive Text

-- | The name of the vault.
deleteArchive_vaultName :: Lens' DeleteArchive Text

-- | The ID of the archive to delete.
deleteArchive_archiveId :: Lens' DeleteArchive Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteArchiveResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteArchiveResponse
DeleteArchiveResponse' :: DeleteArchiveResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteArchiveResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newDeleteArchiveResponse :: DeleteArchiveResponse

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Glacier.DeleteArchive.DeleteArchive
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Glacier.DeleteArchive.DeleteArchive
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Glacier.DeleteArchive.DeleteArchive
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Glacier.DeleteArchive.DeleteArchiveResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Glacier.DeleteArchive.DeleteArchiveResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Glacier.DeleteArchive.DeleteArchiveResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Glacier.DeleteArchive.DeleteArchiveResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.Glacier.DeleteArchive.DeleteArchive
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Glacier.DeleteArchive.DeleteArchiveResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Glacier.DeleteArchive.DeleteArchive
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Glacier.DeleteArchive.DeleteArchive
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.Glacier.DeleteArchive.DeleteArchive
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.Glacier.DeleteArchive.DeleteArchive
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Glacier.DeleteArchive.DeleteArchive


-- | This operation creates a new vault with the specified name. The name
--   of the vault must be unique within a region for an AWS account. You
--   can create up to 1,000 vaults per account. If you need to create more
--   vaults, contact Amazon S3 Glacier.
--   
--   You must use the following guidelines when naming a vault.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Names can be between 1 and 255 characters long.</li>
--   <li>Allowed characters are a-z, A-Z, 0-9, '_' (underscore), '-'
--   (hyphen), and '.' (period).</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   This operation is idempotent.
--   
--   An AWS account has full permission to perform all operations
--   (actions). However, AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) users
--   don't have any permissions by default. You must grant them explicit
--   permission to perform specific actions. For more information, see
--   <a>Access Control Using AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM)</a>.
--   
--   For conceptual information and underlying REST API, see <a>Creating a
--   Vault in Amazon Glacier</a> and <a>Create Vault</a> in the <i>Amazon
--   Glacier Developer Guide</i>.
module Network.AWS.Glacier.CreateVault

-- | Provides options to create a vault.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateVault</a> smart constructor.
data CreateVault
CreateVault' :: Text -> Text -> CreateVault

-- | The <tt>AccountId</tt> value is the AWS account ID. This value must
--   match the AWS account ID associated with the credentials used to sign
--   the request. You can either specify an AWS account ID or optionally a
--   single '<tt>-</tt>' (hyphen), in which case Amazon S3 Glacier uses the
--   AWS account ID associated with the credentials used to sign the
--   request. If you specify your account ID, do not include any hyphens
--   ('-') in the ID.
[$sel:accountId:CreateVault'] :: CreateVault -> Text

-- | The name of the vault.
[$sel:vaultName:CreateVault'] :: CreateVault -> Text

--   the AWS account ID associated with the credentials used to sign the
--   request. You can either specify an AWS account ID or optionally a
--   single '<tt>-</tt>' (hyphen), in which case Amazon S3 Glacier uses the
--   AWS account ID associated with the credentials used to sign the
--   request. If you specify your account ID, do not include any hyphens
--   ('-') in the ID.

--   name of the vault.
newCreateVault :: Text -> Text -> CreateVault

--   match the AWS account ID associated with the credentials used to sign
--   the request. You can either specify an AWS account ID or optionally a
