--   previous List Jobs response. You only need to include the marker if
--   you are continuing the pagination of results started in a previous
--   List Jobs request.

-- | The <tt>AccountId</tt> value is the AWS account ID of the account that
--   owns the vault. You can either specify an AWS account ID or optionally
--   a single '<tt>-</tt>' (hyphen), in which case Amazon S3 Glacier uses
--   the AWS account ID associated with the credentials used to sign the
--   request. If you use an account ID, do not include any hyphens ('-') in
--   the ID.
uploadMultipartPart_accountId :: Lens' UploadMultipartPart Text

-- | The name of the vault.
uploadMultipartPart_vaultName :: Lens' UploadMultipartPart Text

-- | The upload ID of the multipart upload.
uploadMultipartPart_uploadId :: Lens' UploadMultipartPart Text

-- | Identifies the range of bytes in the assembled archive that will be
--   uploaded in this part. Amazon S3 Glacier uses this information to
--   assemble the archive in the proper sequence. The format of this header
--   follows RFC 2616. An example header is Content-Range:bytes
--   0-4194303/*.
uploadMultipartPart_range :: Lens' UploadMultipartPart Text

-- | The SHA256 tree hash of the data being uploaded.
uploadMultipartPart_checksum :: Lens' UploadMultipartPart Text

-- | The data to upload.
uploadMultipartPart_body :: Lens' UploadMultipartPart HashedBody

-- | The SHA256 tree hash that Amazon S3 Glacier computed for the uploaded
--   part.
uploadMultipartPartResponse_checksum :: Lens' UploadMultipartPartResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
uploadMultipartPartResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UploadMultipartPartResponse Int

-- | The ID of the archive. This value is also included as part of the
--   location.
archiveCreationOutput_archiveId :: Lens' ArchiveCreationOutput (Maybe Text)

-- | The checksum of the archive computed by Amazon S3 Glacier.
archiveCreationOutput_checksum :: Lens' ArchiveCreationOutput (Maybe Text)

-- | The relative URI path of the newly added archive resource.
archiveCreationOutput_location :: Lens' ArchiveCreationOutput (Maybe Text)

-- | A value used to separate individual records from each other.
cSVInput_recordDelimiter :: Lens' CSVInput (Maybe Text)

-- | A value used as an escape character where the field delimiter is part
--   of the value.
cSVInput_quoteCharacter :: Lens' CSVInput (Maybe Text)

-- | Describes the first line of input. Valid values are <tt>None</tt>,
--   <tt>Ignore</tt>, and <tt>Use</tt>.
cSVInput_fileHeaderInfo :: Lens' CSVInput (Maybe FileHeaderInfo)

-- | A value used to separate individual fields from each other within a
--   record.
cSVInput_fieldDelimiter :: Lens' CSVInput (Maybe Text)

-- | A single character used to indicate that a row should be ignored when
--   the character is present at the start of that row.
cSVInput_comments :: Lens' CSVInput (Maybe Text)

-- | A single character used for escaping the quotation-mark character
--   inside an already escaped value.
cSVInput_quoteEscapeCharacter :: Lens' CSVInput (Maybe Text)

-- | A value used to separate individual records from each other.
cSVOutput_recordDelimiter :: Lens' CSVOutput (Maybe Text)

-- | A value used as an escape character where the field delimiter is part
--   of the value.
cSVOutput_quoteCharacter :: Lens' CSVOutput (Maybe Text)

-- | A value used to separate individual fields from each other within a
--   record.
cSVOutput_fieldDelimiter :: Lens' CSVOutput (Maybe Text)

-- | A value that indicates whether all output fields should be contained
--   within quotation marks.
cSVOutput_quoteFields :: Lens' CSVOutput (Maybe QuoteFields)

-- | A single character used for escaping the quotation-mark character
--   inside an already escaped value.
cSVOutput_quoteEscapeCharacter :: Lens' CSVOutput (Maybe Text)

-- | The policy rule. Although this is a list type, currently there must be
--   only one rule, which contains a Strategy field and optionally a
--   BytesPerHour field.
dataRetrievalPolicy_rules :: Lens' DataRetrievalPolicy (Maybe [DataRetrievalRule])

-- | The maximum number of bytes that can be retrieved in an hour.
--   
--   This field is required only if the value of the Strategy field is
--   <tt>BytesPerHour</tt>. Your PUT operation will be rejected if the
--   Strategy field is not set to <tt>BytesPerHour</tt> and you set this
--   field.
dataRetrievalRule_bytesPerHour :: Lens' DataRetrievalRule (Maybe Integer)

-- | The type of data retrieval policy to set.
--   
--   Valid values: BytesPerHour|FreeTier|None
dataRetrievalRule_strategy :: Lens' DataRetrievalRule (Maybe Text)

-- | The Universal Coordinated Time (UTC) date when Amazon S3 Glacier
--   completed the last vault inventory. This value should be a string in
--   the ISO 8601 date format, for example
--   <tt>2012-03-20T17:03:43.221Z</tt>.
describeVaultOutput_lastInventoryDate :: Lens' DescribeVaultOutput (Maybe Text)

-- | The Universal Coordinated Time (UTC) date when the vault was created.
--   This value should be a string in the ISO 8601 date format, for example
--   <tt>2012-03-20T17:03:43.221Z</tt>.
describeVaultOutput_creationDate :: Lens' DescribeVaultOutput (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the vault.
describeVaultOutput_vaultName :: Lens' DescribeVaultOutput (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the vault.
describeVaultOutput_vaultARN :: Lens' DescribeVaultOutput (Maybe Text)

-- | Total size, in bytes, of the archives in the vault as of the last
--   inventory date. This field will return null if an inventory has not
--   yet run on the vault, for example if you just created the vault.
describeVaultOutput_sizeInBytes :: Lens' DescribeVaultOutput (Maybe Integer)

-- | The number of archives in the vault as of the last inventory date.
--   This field will return <tt>null</tt> if an inventory has not yet run
--   on the vault, for example if you just created the vault.
describeVaultOutput_numberOfArchives :: Lens' DescribeVaultOutput (Maybe Integer)

-- | The server-side encryption algorithm used when storing job results in
--   Amazon S3, for example <tt>AES256</tt> or <tt>aws:kms</tt>.
encryption_encryptionType :: Lens' Encryption (Maybe EncryptionType)

-- | The AWS KMS key ID to use for object encryption. All GET and PUT
--   requests for an object protected by AWS KMS fail if not made by using
--   Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) or Signature Version 4.
encryption_kmsKeyId :: Lens' Encryption (Maybe Text)

-- | Optional. If the encryption type is <tt>aws:kms</tt>, you can use this
--   value to specify the encryption context for the job results.
encryption_kmsContext :: Lens' Encryption (Maybe Text)

-- | For an archive retrieval job, this value is the checksum of the
--   archive. Otherwise, this value is null.
--   
--   The SHA256 tree hash value for the requested range of an archive. If
--   the <b>InitiateJob</b> request for an archive specified a tree-hash
--   aligned range, then this field returns a value.
--   
--   If the whole archive is retrieved, this value is the same as the
--   ArchiveSHA256TreeHash value.
--   
--   This field is null for the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Archive retrieval jobs that specify a range that is not tree-hash
--   aligned</li>
--   <li>Archival jobs that specify a range that is equal to the whole
--   archive, when the job status is <tt>InProgress</tt></li>
--   <li>Inventory jobs</li>
--   <li>Select jobs</li>
--   </ul>
glacierJobDescription_sHA256TreeHash :: Lens' GlacierJobDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | A friendly message that describes the job status.
glacierJobDescription_statusMessage :: Lens' GlacierJobDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The job description provided when initiating the job.
glacierJobDescription_jobDescription :: Lens' GlacierJobDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The retrieved byte range for archive retrieval jobs in the form
--   <i>StartByteValue</i>-<i>EndByteValue</i>. If no range was specified
--   in the archive retrieval, then the whole archive is retrieved. In this
--   case, <i>StartByteValue</i> equals 0 and <i>EndByteValue</i> equals
--   the size of the archive minus 1. For inventory retrieval or select
--   jobs, this field is null.
glacierJobDescription_retrievalByteRange :: Lens' GlacierJobDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains the job output location.
glacierJobDescription_jobOutputPath :: Lens' GlacierJobDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The UTC date when the job was created. This value is a string
--   representation of ISO 8601 date format, for example
--   <tt>"2012-03-20T17:03:43.221Z"</tt>.
glacierJobDescription_creationDate :: Lens' GlacierJobDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains the parameters used for a select.
glacierJobDescription_selectParameters :: Lens' GlacierJobDescription (Maybe SelectParameters)

-- | An Amazon SNS topic that receives notification.
glacierJobDescription_sNSTopic :: Lens' GlacierJobDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the vault from which an archive
--   retrieval was requested.
glacierJobDescription_vaultARN :: Lens' GlacierJobDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The archive ID requested for a select job or archive retrieval.
--   Otherwise, this field is null.
glacierJobDescription_archiveId :: Lens' GlacierJobDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The status code can be <tt>InProgress</tt>, <tt>Succeeded</tt>, or
--   <tt>Failed</tt>, and indicates the status of the job.
glacierJobDescription_statusCode :: Lens' GlacierJobDescription (Maybe StatusCode)

-- | For an inventory retrieval job, this value is the size in bytes of the
--   inventory requested for download. For an archive retrieval or select
--   job, this value is null.
glacierJobDescription_inventorySizeInBytes :: Lens' GlacierJobDescription (Maybe Integer)

-- | For an archive retrieval job, this value is the size in bytes of the
--   archive being requested for download. For an inventory retrieval or
--   select job, this value is null.
glacierJobDescription_archiveSizeInBytes :: Lens' GlacierJobDescription (Maybe Integer)

-- | The job type. This value is either <tt>ArchiveRetrieval</tt>,
--   <tt>InventoryRetrieval</tt>, or <tt>Select</tt>.
glacierJobDescription_action :: Lens' GlacierJobDescription (Maybe ActionCode)

-- | Parameters used for range inventory retrieval.
glacierJobDescription_inventoryRetrievalParameters :: Lens' GlacierJobDescription (Maybe InventoryRetrievalJobDescription)

-- | The UTC time that the job request completed. While the job is in
--   progress, the value is null.
glacierJobDescription_completionDate :: Lens' GlacierJobDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The job status. When a job is completed, you get the job's output
--   using Get Job Output (GET output).
glacierJobDescription_completed :: Lens' GlacierJobDescription (Maybe Bool)

-- | The SHA256 tree hash of the entire archive for an archive retrieval.
--   For inventory retrieval or select jobs, this field is null.
glacierJobDescription_archiveSHA256TreeHash :: Lens' GlacierJobDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The tier to use for a select or an archive retrieval. Valid values are
--   <tt>Expedited</tt>, <tt>Standard</tt>, or <tt>Bulk</tt>.
--   <tt>Standard</tt> is the default.
glacierJobDescription_tier :: Lens' GlacierJobDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | An opaque string that identifies an Amazon S3 Glacier job.
glacierJobDescription_jobId :: Lens' GlacierJobDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains the location where the data from the select job is stored.
glacierJobDescription_outputLocation :: Lens' GlacierJobDescription (Maybe OutputLocation)

-- | The grantee.
grant_grantee :: Lens' Grant (Maybe Grantee)

-- | Specifies the permission given to the grantee.
grant_permission :: Lens' Grant (Maybe Permission)

-- | URI of the grantee group.
grantee_uri :: Lens' Grantee (Maybe Text)

-- | The canonical user ID of the grantee.
grantee_id :: Lens' Grantee (Maybe Text)

-- | Screen name of the grantee.
grantee_displayName :: Lens' Grantee (Maybe Text)

-- | Email address of the grantee.
grantee_emailAddress :: Lens' Grantee (Maybe Text)

-- | Type of grantee
grantee_type :: Lens' Grantee Type

-- | Describes the serialization of a CSV-encoded object.
inputSerialization_csv :: Lens' InputSerialization (Maybe CSVInput)

-- | The start of the date range in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC) for
--   vault inventory retrieval that includes archives created on or after
--   this date. This value should be a string in the ISO 8601 date format,
--   for example <tt>2013-03-20T17:03:43Z</tt>.
inventoryRetrievalJobDescription_startDate :: Lens' InventoryRetrievalJobDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The output format for the vault inventory list, which is set by the
--   <b>InitiateJob</b> request when initiating a job to retrieve a vault
--   inventory. Valid values are <tt>CSV</tt> and <tt>JSON</tt>.
inventoryRetrievalJobDescription_format :: Lens' InventoryRetrievalJobDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The end of the date range in UTC for vault inventory retrieval that
--   includes archives created before this date. This value should be a
--   string in the ISO 8601 date format, for example
--   <tt>2013-03-20T17:03:43Z</tt>.
inventoryRetrievalJobDescription_endDate :: Lens' InventoryRetrievalJobDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of inventory items returned per vault inventory
--   retrieval request. This limit is set when initiating the job with the
--   a <b>InitiateJob</b> request.
inventoryRetrievalJobDescription_limit :: Lens' InventoryRetrievalJobDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | An opaque string that represents where to continue pagination of the
--   vault inventory retrieval results. You use the marker in a new
--   <b>InitiateJob</b> request to obtain additional inventory items. If
--   there are no more inventory items, this value is <tt>null</tt>. For
--   more information, see <a>Range Inventory Retrieval</a>.
inventoryRetrievalJobDescription_marker :: Lens' InventoryRetrievalJobDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The start of the date range in UTC for vault inventory retrieval that
--   includes archives created on or after this date. This value should be
--   a string in the ISO 8601 date format, for example
--   <tt>2013-03-20T17:03:43Z</tt>.
inventoryRetrievalJobInput_startDate :: Lens' InventoryRetrievalJobInput (Maybe Text)

-- | The end of the date range in UTC for vault inventory retrieval that
--   includes archives created before this date. This value should be a
--   string in the ISO 8601 date format, for example
--   <tt>2013-03-20T17:03:43Z</tt>.
inventoryRetrievalJobInput_endDate :: Lens' InventoryRetrievalJobInput (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the maximum number of inventory items returned per vault
--   inventory retrieval request. Valid values are greater than or equal to
--   1.
inventoryRetrievalJobInput_limit :: Lens' InventoryRetrievalJobInput (Maybe Text)

-- | An opaque string that represents where to continue pagination of the
--   vault inventory retrieval results. You use the marker in a new
--   <b>InitiateJob</b> request to obtain additional inventory items. If
--   there are no more inventory items, this value is <tt>null</tt>.
inventoryRetrievalJobInput_marker :: Lens' InventoryRetrievalJobInput (Maybe Text)

-- | When initiating a job to retrieve a vault inventory, you can
--   optionally add this parameter to your request to specify the output
--   format. If you are initiating an inventory job and do not specify a
--   Format field, JSON is the default format. Valid values are "CSV" and
--   "JSON".
jobParameters_format :: Lens' JobParameters (Maybe Text)

-- | The byte range to retrieve for an archive retrieval. in the form
--   "<i>StartByteValue</i>-<i>EndByteValue</i>" If not specified, the
--   whole archive is retrieved. If specified, the byte range must be
--   megabyte (1024*1024) aligned which means that <i>StartByteValue</i>
--   must be divisible by 1 MB and <i>EndByteValue</i> plus 1 must be
--   divisible by 1 MB or be the end of the archive specified as the
--   archive byte size value minus 1. If RetrievalByteRange is not megabyte
--   aligned, this operation returns a 400 response.
--   
--   An error occurs if you specify this field for an inventory retrieval
--   job request.
jobParameters_retrievalByteRange :: Lens' JobParameters (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains the parameters that define a job.
jobParameters_selectParameters :: Lens' JobParameters (Maybe SelectParameters)

-- | The Amazon SNS topic ARN to which Amazon S3 Glacier sends a
--   notification when the job is completed and the output is ready for you
--   to download. The specified topic publishes the notification to its
--   subscribers. The SNS topic must exist.
jobParameters_sNSTopic :: Lens' JobParameters (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the archive that you want to retrieve. This field is
--   required only if <tt>Type</tt> is set to <tt>select</tt> or
--   <tt>archive-retrieval</tt>code&gt;. An error occurs if you specify
--   this request parameter for an inventory retrieval job request.
jobParameters_archiveId :: Lens' JobParameters (Maybe Text)

-- | The optional description for the job. The description must be less
--   than or equal to 1,024 bytes. The allowable characters are 7-bit ASCII
--   without control codes-specifically, ASCII values 32-126 decimal or
--   0x20-0x7E hexadecimal.
jobParameters_description :: Lens' JobParameters (Maybe Text)

-- | Input parameters used for range inventory retrieval.
jobParameters_inventoryRetrievalParameters :: Lens' JobParameters (Maybe InventoryRetrievalJobInput)

-- | The job type. You can initiate a job to perform a select query on an
--   archive, retrieve an archive, or get an inventory of a vault. Valid
--   values are "select", "archive-retrieval" and "inventory-retrieval".
jobParameters_type :: Lens' JobParameters (Maybe Text)

-- | The tier to use for a select or an archive retrieval job. Valid values
--   are <tt>Expedited</tt>, <tt>Standard</tt>, or <tt>Bulk</tt>.
--   <tt>Standard</tt> is the default.
jobParameters_tier :: Lens' JobParameters (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains information about the location where the select job results
--   are stored.
jobParameters_outputLocation :: Lens' JobParameters (Maybe OutputLocation)

-- | Describes an S3 location that will receive the results of the job
--   request.
outputLocation_s3 :: Lens' OutputLocation (Maybe S3Location)

-- | Describes the serialization of CSV-encoded query results.
outputSerialization_csv :: Lens' OutputSerialization (Maybe CSVOutput)

-- | The SHA256 tree hash value that Amazon S3 Glacier calculated for the
--   part. This field is never <tt>null</tt>.
partListElement_sHA256TreeHash :: Lens' PartListElement (Maybe Text)

-- | The byte range of a part, inclusive of the upper value of the range.
partListElement_rangeInBytes :: Lens' PartListElement (Maybe Text)

-- | The date that the provisioned capacity unit was purchased, in
--   Universal Coordinated Time (UTC).
provisionedCapacityDescription_startDate :: Lens' ProvisionedCapacityDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID that identifies the provisioned capacity unit.
provisionedCapacityDescription_capacityId :: Lens' ProvisionedCapacityDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The date that the provisioned capacity unit expires, in Universal
--   Coordinated Time (UTC).
provisionedCapacityDescription_expirationDate :: Lens' ProvisionedCapacityDescription (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the Amazon S3 bucket where the job results are stored.
s3Location_bucketName :: Lens' S3Location (Maybe Text)

-- | The prefix that is prepended to the results for this request.
s3Location_prefix :: Lens' S3Location (Maybe Text)

-- | The canned access control list (ACL) to apply to the job results.
s3Location_cannedACL :: Lens' S3Location (Maybe CannedACL)

-- | Contains information about the encryption used to store the job
--   results in Amazon S3.
s3Location_encryption :: Lens' S3Location (Maybe Encryption)

-- | The storage class used to store the job results.
s3Location_storageClass :: Lens' S3Location (Maybe StorageClass)

-- | A map of metadata to store with the job results in Amazon S3.
s3Location_userMetadata :: Lens' S3Location (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | A list of grants that control access to the staged results.
s3Location_accessControlList :: Lens' S3Location (Maybe [Grant])

-- | The tag-set that is applied to the job results.
s3Location_tagging :: Lens' S3Location (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The type of the provided expression, for example <tt>SQL</tt>.
selectParameters_expressionType :: Lens' SelectParameters (Maybe ExpressionType)

-- | Describes how the results of the select job are serialized.
selectParameters_outputSerialization :: Lens' SelectParameters (Maybe OutputSerialization)

-- | Describes the serialization format of the object.
selectParameters_inputSerialization :: Lens' SelectParameters (Maybe InputSerialization)

-- | The expression that is used to select the object.
selectParameters_expression :: Lens' SelectParameters (Maybe Text)

-- | The part size, in bytes, specified in the Initiate Multipart Upload
--   request. This is the size of all the parts in the upload except the
--   last part, which may be smaller than this size.
uploadListElement_partSizeInBytes :: Lens' UploadListElement (Maybe Integer)

-- | The UTC time at which the multipart upload was initiated.
uploadListElement_creationDate :: Lens' UploadListElement (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the vault that contains the archive.
uploadListElement_vaultARN :: Lens' UploadListElement (Maybe Text)

-- | The description of the archive that was specified in the Initiate
--   Multipart Upload request.
uploadListElement_archiveDescription :: Lens' UploadListElement (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of a multipart upload.
uploadListElement_multipartUploadId :: Lens' UploadListElement (Maybe Text)

-- | The vault access policy.
vaultAccessPolicy_policy :: Lens' VaultAccessPolicy (Maybe Text)

-- | The vault lock policy.
vaultLockPolicy_policy :: Lens' VaultLockPolicy (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of one or more events for which Amazon S3 Glacier will send a
--   notification to the specified Amazon SNS topic.
vaultNotificationConfig_events :: Lens' VaultNotificationConfig (Maybe [Text])

-- | The Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS) topic Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN).
vaultNotificationConfig_sNSTopic :: Lens' VaultNotificationConfig (Maybe Text)


module Network.AWS.Glacier.Waiters

-- | Polls <a>DescribeVault</a> every 3 seconds until a successful state is
--   reached. An error is returned after 15 failed checks.
newVaultExists :: Wait DescribeVault

-- | Polls <a>DescribeVault</a> every 3 seconds until a successful state is
--   reached. An error is returned after 15 failed checks.
newVaultNotExists :: Wait DescribeVault


-- | Derived from API version <tt>2012-06-01</tt> of the AWS service
--   descriptions, licensed under Apache 2.0.
--   
--   Amazon S3 Glacier (Glacier) is a storage solution for "cold data."
--   
--   Glacier is an extremely low-cost storage service that provides secure,
--   durable, and easy-to-use storage for data backup and archival. With
--   Glacier, customers can store their data cost effectively for months,
--   years, or decades. Glacier also enables customers to offload the
--   administrative burdens of operating and scaling storage to AWS, so
--   they don't have to worry about capacity planning, hardware
--   provisioning, data replication, hardware failure and recovery, or
--   time-consuming hardware migrations.
--   
--   Glacier is a great storage choice when low storage cost is paramount
--   and your data is rarely retrieved. If your application requires fast
--   or frequent access to your data, consider using Amazon S3. For more
--   information, see <a>Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3)</a>.
--   
--   You can store any kind of data in any format. There is no maximum
--   limit on the total amount of data you can store in Glacier.
--   
--   If you are a first-time user of Glacier, we recommend that you begin
--   by reading the following sections in the /Amazon S3 Glacier Developer
--   Guide/:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><a>What is Amazon S3 Glacier</a></li>
--   <li>This section of the Developer Guide describes the underlying data
--   model, the operations it supports, and the AWS SDKs that you can use
--   to interact with the service.</li>
--   <li><a>Getting Started with Amazon S3 Glacier</a></li>
--   <li>The Getting Started section walks you through the process of
--   creating a vault, uploading archives, creating jobs to download
--   archives, retrieving the job output, and deleting archives.</li>
--   </ul>
module Network.AWS.Glacier

-- | API version <tt>2012-06-01</tt> of the Amazon Glacier SDK
--   configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | Returned if the service cannot complete the request.
_ServiceUnavailableException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Returned if a retrieval job would exceed the current data policy's
--   retrieval rate limit. For more information about data retrieval
--   policies,
_PolicyEnforcedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Returned if a parameter of the request is incorrectly specified.
_InvalidParameterValueException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Returned if a required header or parameter is missing from the
--   request.
_MissingParameterValueException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Returned if the request results in a vault or account limit being
--   exceeded.
_LimitExceededException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Returned if the specified resource (such as a vault, upload ID, or job
--   ID) doesn't exist.
_ResourceNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Returned if there is insufficient capacity to process this expedited
--   request. This error only applies to expedited retrievals and not to
--   standard or bulk retrievals.
_InsufficientCapacityException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Returned if, when uploading an archive, Amazon S3 Glacier times out
--   while receiving the upload.
_RequestTimeoutException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Polls <a>DescribeVault</a> every 3 seconds until a successful state is
--   reached. An error is returned after 15 failed checks.
newVaultExists :: Wait DescribeVault

-- | Polls <a>DescribeVault</a> every 3 seconds until a successful state is
--   reached. An error is returned after 15 failed checks.
newVaultNotExists :: Wait DescribeVault

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newPurchaseProvisionedCapacity</a> smart constructor.
data PurchaseProvisionedCapacity
PurchaseProvisionedCapacity' :: Text -> PurchaseProvisionedCapacity

-- | Create a value of <a>PurchaseProvisionedCapacity</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:PurchaseProvisionedCapacity'</a>,
--   <a>purchaseProvisionedCapacity_accountId</a> - The AWS account ID of
--   the account that owns the vault. You can either specify an AWS account
--   ID or optionally a single '-' (hyphen), in which case Amazon S3
--   Glacier uses the AWS account ID associated with the credentials used
--   to sign the request. If you use an account ID, don't include any
--   hyphens ('-') in the ID.
newPurchaseProvisionedCapacity :: Text -> PurchaseProvisionedCapacity

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newPurchaseProvisionedCapacityResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data PurchaseProvisionedCapacityResponse
PurchaseProvisionedCapacityResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> PurchaseProvisionedCapacityResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>PurchaseProvisionedCapacityResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:capacityId:PurchaseProvisionedCapacityResponse'</a>,
--   <a>purchaseProvisionedCapacityResponse_capacityId</a> - The ID that
--   identifies the provisioned capacity unit.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:PurchaseProvisionedCapacityResponse'</a>,
--   <a>purchaseProvisionedCapacityResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's
--   http status code.
newPurchaseProvisionedCapacityResponse :: Int -> PurchaseProvisionedCapacityResponse

-- | Provides options for retrieving metadata for a specific vault in
--   Amazon Glacier.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeVault</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeVault
DescribeVault' :: Text -> Text -> DescribeVault

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeVault</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:DescribeVault'</a>, <a>describeVault_accountId</a> -
--   The <tt>AccountId</tt> value is the AWS account ID of the account that
--   owns the vault. You can either specify an AWS account ID or optionally
--   a single '<tt>-</tt>' (hyphen), in which case Amazon S3 Glacier uses
--   the AWS account ID associated with the credentials used to sign the
--   request. If you use an account ID, do not include any hyphens ('-') in
--   the ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vaultName:DescribeVault'</a>, <a>describeVault_vaultName</a> -
--   The name of the vault.
newDescribeVault :: Text -> Text -> DescribeVault

-- | Contains the Amazon S3 Glacier response to your request.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeVaultOutput</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeVaultOutput
DescribeVaultOutput' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> DescribeVaultOutput

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeVaultOutput</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastInventoryDate:DescribeVaultOutput'</a>,
--   <a>describeVaultOutput_lastInventoryDate</a> - The Universal
--   Coordinated Time (UTC) date when Amazon S3 Glacier completed the last
--   vault inventory. This value should be a string in the ISO 8601 date
--   format, for example <tt>2012-03-20T17:03:43.221Z</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:DescribeVaultOutput'</a>,
--   <a>describeVaultOutput_creationDate</a> - The Universal Coordinated
--   Time (UTC) date when the vault was created. This value should be a
--   string in the ISO 8601 date format, for example
--   <tt>2012-03-20T17:03:43.221Z</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vaultName:DescribeVaultOutput'</a>,
--   <a>describeVaultOutput_vaultName</a> - The name of the vault.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vaultARN:DescribeVaultOutput'</a>,
--   <a>describeVaultOutput_vaultARN</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the vault.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sizeInBytes:DescribeVaultOutput'</a>,
--   <a>describeVaultOutput_sizeInBytes</a> - Total size, in bytes, of the
--   archives in the vault as of the last inventory date. This field will
--   return null if an inventory has not yet run on the vault, for example
--   if you just created the vault.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfArchives:DescribeVaultOutput'</a>,
--   <a>describeVaultOutput_numberOfArchives</a> - The number of archives
--   in the vault as of the last inventory date. This field will return
--   <tt>null</tt> if an inventory has not yet run on the vault, for
--   example if you just created the vault.
newDescribeVaultOutput :: DescribeVaultOutput

-- | Provides options to complete a multipart upload operation. This
--   informs Amazon Glacier that all the archive parts have been uploaded
--   and Amazon S3 Glacier (Glacier) can now assemble the archive from the
--   uploaded parts. After assembling and saving the archive to the vault,
--   Glacier returns the URI path of the newly created archive resource.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCompleteMultipartUpload</a> smart constructor.
data CompleteMultipartUpload
CompleteMultipartUpload' :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> CompleteMultipartUpload

-- | Create a value of <a>CompleteMultipartUpload</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:CompleteMultipartUpload'</a>,
--   <a>completeMultipartUpload_accountId</a> - The <tt>AccountId</tt>
--   value is the AWS account ID of the account that owns the vault. You
--   can either specify an AWS account ID or optionally a single
--   '<tt>-</tt>' (hyphen), in which case Amazon S3 Glacier uses the AWS
--   account ID associated with the credentials used to sign the request.
--   If you use an account ID, do not include any hyphens ('-') in the ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vaultName:CompleteMultipartUpload'</a>,
--   <a>completeMultipartUpload_vaultName</a> - The name of the vault.
--   
--   <a>$sel:uploadId:CompleteMultipartUpload'</a>,
--   <a>completeMultipartUpload_uploadId</a> - The upload ID of the
--   multipart upload.
--   
--   <a>$sel:archiveSize:CompleteMultipartUpload'</a>,
--   <a>completeMultipartUpload_archiveSize</a> - The total size, in bytes,
--   of the entire archive. This value should be the sum of all the sizes
--   of the individual parts that you uploaded.
--   
--   <a>$sel:checksum:CompleteMultipartUpload'</a>,
--   <a>completeMultipartUpload_checksum</a> - The SHA256 tree hash of the
--   entire archive. It is the tree hash of SHA256 tree hash of the
--   individual parts. If the value you specify in the request does not
--   match the SHA256 tree hash of the final assembled archive as computed
--   by Amazon S3 Glacier (Glacier), Glacier returns an error and the
--   request fails.
newCompleteMultipartUpload :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> CompleteMultipartUpload

-- | Contains the description of an Amazon S3 Glacier job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGlacierJobDescription</a> smart constructor.
data GlacierJobDescription
GlacierJobDescription' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe SelectParameters -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe StatusCode -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe ActionCode -> Maybe InventoryRetrievalJobDescription -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe OutputLocation -> GlacierJobDescription

-- | Create a value of <a>GlacierJobDescription</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sHA256TreeHash:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_sHA256TreeHash</a> - For an archive retrieval
--   job, this value is the checksum of the archive. Otherwise, this value
--   is null.
--   
--   The SHA256 tree hash value for the requested range of an archive. If
--   the <b>InitiateJob</b> request for an archive specified a tree-hash
--   aligned range, then this field returns a value.
--   
--   If the whole archive is retrieved, this value is the same as the
--   ArchiveSHA256TreeHash value.
--   
--   This field is null for the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Archive retrieval jobs that specify a range that is not tree-hash
--   aligned</li>
--   <li>Archival jobs that specify a range that is equal to the whole
--   archive, when the job status is <tt>InProgress</tt></li>
--   <li>Inventory jobs</li>
--   <li>Select jobs</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusMessage:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_statusMessage</a> - A friendly message that
--   describes the job status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobDescription:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_jobDescription</a> - The job description
--   provided when initiating the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:retrievalByteRange:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_retrievalByteRange</a> - The retrieved byte
--   range for archive retrieval jobs in the form
--   <i>StartByteValue</i>-<i>EndByteValue</i>. If no range was specified
--   in the archive retrieval, then the whole archive is retrieved. In this
--   case, <i>StartByteValue</i> equals 0 and <i>EndByteValue</i> equals
--   the size of the archive minus 1. For inventory retrieval or select
--   jobs, this field is null.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobOutputPath:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_jobOutputPath</a> - Contains the job output
--   location.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_creationDate</a> - The UTC date when the job
--   was created. This value is a string representation of ISO 8601 date
--   format, for example <tt>"2012-03-20T17:03:43.221Z"</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:selectParameters:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_selectParameters</a> - Contains the
--   parameters used for a select.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sNSTopic:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_sNSTopic</a> - An Amazon SNS topic that
--   receives notification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vaultARN:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_vaultARN</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the vault from which an archive retrieval was requested.
--   
--   <a>$sel:archiveId:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_archiveId</a> - The archive ID requested for
--   a select job or archive retrieval. Otherwise, this field is null.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusCode:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_statusCode</a> - The status code can be
--   <tt>InProgress</tt>, <tt>Succeeded</tt>, or <tt>Failed</tt>, and
--   indicates the status of the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inventorySizeInBytes:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_inventorySizeInBytes</a> - For an inventory
--   retrieval job, this value is the size in bytes of the inventory
--   requested for download. For an archive retrieval or select job, this
--   value is null.
--   
--   <a>$sel:archiveSizeInBytes:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_archiveSizeInBytes</a> - For an archive
--   retrieval job, this value is the size in bytes of the archive being
--   requested for download. For an inventory retrieval or select job, this
--   value is null.
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_action</a> - The job type. This value is
--   either <tt>ArchiveRetrieval</tt>, <tt>InventoryRetrieval</tt>, or
--   <tt>Select</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inventoryRetrievalParameters:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_inventoryRetrievalParameters</a> - Parameters
--   used for range inventory retrieval.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completionDate:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_completionDate</a> - The UTC time that the
--   job request completed. While the job is in progress, the value is
--   null.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completed:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_completed</a> - The job status. When a job is
--   completed, you get the job's output using Get Job Output (GET output).
--   
--   <a>$sel:archiveSHA256TreeHash:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_archiveSHA256TreeHash</a> - The SHA256 tree
--   hash of the entire archive for an archive retrieval. For inventory
--   retrieval or select jobs, this field is null.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tier:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_tier</a> - The tier to use for a select or an
--   archive retrieval. Valid values are <tt>Expedited</tt>,
--   <tt>Standard</tt>, or <tt>Bulk</tt>. <tt>Standard</tt> is the default.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobId:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_jobId</a> - An opaque string that identifies
--   an Amazon S3 Glacier job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputLocation:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_outputLocation</a> - Contains the location
--   where the data from the select job is stored.
newGlacierJobDescription :: GlacierJobDescription

--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newAddTagsToVaultResponse :: AddTagsToVaultResponse

-- | Provides options for initiating a multipart upload to an Amazon S3
--   Glacier vault.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInitiateMultipartUpload</a> smart constructor.
data InitiateMultipartUpload
InitiateMultipartUpload' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> InitiateMultipartUpload

-- | Create a value of <a>InitiateMultipartUpload</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:archiveDescription:InitiateMultipartUpload'</a>,
--   <a>initiateMultipartUpload_archiveDescription</a> - The archive
--   description that you are uploading in parts.
--   
--   The part size must be a megabyte (1024 KB) multiplied by a power of 2,
--   for example 1048576 (1 MB), 2097152 (2 MB), 4194304 (4 MB), 8388608 (8
--   MB), and so on. The minimum allowable part size is 1 MB, and the
--   maximum is 4 GB (4096 MB).
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:InitiateMultipartUpload'</a>,
--   <a>initiateMultipartUpload_accountId</a> - The <tt>AccountId</tt>
--   value is the AWS account ID of the account that owns the vault. You
--   can either specify an AWS account ID or optionally a single
--   '<tt>-</tt>' (hyphen), in which case Amazon S3 Glacier uses the AWS
--   account ID associated with the credentials used to sign the request.
--   If you use an account ID, do not include any hyphens ('-') in the ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vaultName:InitiateMultipartUpload'</a>,
--   <a>initiateMultipartUpload_vaultName</a> - The name of the vault.
--   
--   <a>$sel:partSize:InitiateMultipartUpload'</a>,
--   <a>initiateMultipartUpload_partSize</a> - The size of each part except
--   the last, in bytes. The last part can be smaller than this part size.
newInitiateMultipartUpload :: Text -> Text -> Text -> InitiateMultipartUpload

-- | The Amazon S3 Glacier response to your request.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInitiateMultipartUploadResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.

--   multipart upload. This value is also included as part of the location.

-- | Provides options for downloading output of an Amazon S3 Glacier job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetJobOutput</a> smart constructor.
data GetJobOutput
GetJobOutput' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> GetJobOutput

-- | Create a value of <a>GetJobOutput</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:range:GetJobOutput'</a>, <a>getJobOutput_range</a> - The range
--   of bytes to retrieve from the output. For example, if you want to
--   download the first 1,048,576 bytes, specify the range as
--   <tt>bytes=0-1048575</tt>. By default, this operation downloads the
--   entire output.
--   
--   If the job output is large, then you can use a range to retrieve a
--   portion of the output. This allows you to download the entire output
--   in smaller chunks of bytes. For example, suppose you have 1 GB of job
--   output you want to download and you decide to download 128 MB chunks
--   of data at a time, which is a total of eight Get Job Output requests.
--   You use the following process to download the job output:
--   
--   <ol>
--   <li>Download a 128 MB chunk of output by specifying the appropriate
--   byte range. Verify that all 128 MB of data was received.</li>
--   <li>Along with the data, the response includes a SHA256 tree hash of
--   the payload. You compute the checksum of the payload on the client and
--   compare it with the checksum you received in the response to ensure
--   you received all the expected data.</li>
--   <li>Repeat steps 1 and 2 for all the eight 128 MB chunks of output
--   data, each time specifying the appropriate byte range.</li>
--   <li>After downloading all the parts of the job output, you have a list
--   of eight checksum values. Compute the tree hash of these values to
--   find the checksum of the entire output. Using the DescribeJob API,
--   obtain job information of the job that provided you the output. The
--   response includes the checksum of the entire archive stored in Amazon
--   S3 Glacier. You compare this value with the checksum you computed to
--   ensure you have downloaded the entire archive content with no
--   errors.</li>
--   </ol>
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:GetJobOutput'</a>, <a>getJobOutput_accountId</a> -
--   The <tt>AccountId</tt> value is the AWS account ID of the account that
--   owns the vault. You can either specify an AWS account ID or optionally
--   a single '<tt>-</tt>' (hyphen), in which case Amazon S3 Glacier uses
--   the AWS account ID associated with the credentials used to sign the
--   request. If you use an account ID, do not include any hyphens ('-') in
--   the ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vaultName:GetJobOutput'</a>, <a>getJobOutput_vaultName</a> -
--   The name of the vault.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobId:GetJobOutput'</a>, <a>getJobOutput_jobId</a> - The job
--   ID whose data is downloaded.
newGetJobOutput :: Text -> Text -> Text -> GetJobOutput

-- | Contains the Amazon S3 Glacier response to your request.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetJobOutputResponse</a> smart constructor.
data GetJobOutputResponse
GetJobOutputResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Int -> ResponseBody -> GetJobOutputResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>GetJobOutputResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentType:GetJobOutputResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getJobOutputResponse_contentType</a> - The Content-Type depends on
--   whether the job output is an archive or a vault inventory. For archive
--   data, the Content-Type is application/octet-stream. For vault
--   inventory, if you requested CSV format when you initiated the job, the
--   Content-Type is text/csv. Otherwise, by default, vault inventory is
--   returned as JSON, and the Content-Type is application/json.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentRange:GetJobOutputResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getJobOutputResponse_contentRange</a> - The range of bytes returned
--   by Amazon S3 Glacier. If only partial output is downloaded, the
--   response provides the range of bytes Amazon S3 Glacier returned. For
--   example, bytes 0-1048575/8388608 returns the first 1 MB from 8 MB.
--   
--   <a>$sel:acceptRanges:GetJobOutputResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getJobOutputResponse_acceptRanges</a> - Indicates the range units
--   accepted. For more information, see <a>RFC2616</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:archiveDescription:GetJobOutputResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getJobOutputResponse_archiveDescription</a> - The description of an
--   archive.
--   
--   <a>$sel:checksum:GetJobOutputResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getJobOutputResponse_checksum</a> - The checksum of the data in the
--   response. This header is returned only when retrieving the output for
--   an archive retrieval job. Furthermore, this header appears only under
--   the following conditions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>You get the entire range of the archive.</li>
--   <li>You request a range to return of the archive that starts and ends
--   on a multiple of 1 MB. For example, if you have an 3.1 MB archive and
--   you specify a range to return that starts at 1 MB and ends at 2 MB,
--   then the x-amz-sha256-tree-hash is returned as a response header.</li>
--   <li>You request a range of the archive to return that starts on a
--   multiple of 1 MB and goes to the end of the archive. For example, if
--   you have a 3.1 MB archive and you specify a range that starts at 2 MB
--   and ends at 3.1 MB (the end of the archive), then the
--   x-amz-sha256-tree-hash is returned as a response header.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:GetJobOutputResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getJobOutputResponse_status</a> - The HTTP response code for a job
--   output request. The value depends on whether a range was specified in
--   the request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:GetJobOutputResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getJobOutputResponse_body</a> - The job data, either archive data
--   or inventory data.
newGetJobOutputResponse :: Int -> ResponseBody -> GetJobOutputResponse

--   of returned parts never exceeds the limit.

--   of a previous List Parts response. You need only include the marker if

--   results. You use the marker in a new List Parts request to obtain more
--   jobs in the list. If there are no more parts, this value is
--   <tt>null</tt>.

--   <a>getDataRetrievalPolicyResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newGetDataRetrievalPolicyResponse :: Int -> GetDataRetrievalPolicyResponse

-- | Provides options to upload a part of an archive in a multipart upload
--   operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUploadMultipartPart</a> smart constructor.
data UploadMultipartPart
UploadMultipartPart' :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> HashedBody -> UploadMultipartPart

-- | Create a value of <a>UploadMultipartPart</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:accountId:UploadMultipartPart'</a>,
--   <a>uploadMultipartPart_accountId</a> - The <tt>AccountId</tt> value is
--   the AWS account ID of the account that owns the vault. You can either
--   specify an AWS account ID or optionally a single '<tt>-</tt>'
--   (hyphen), in which case Amazon S3 Glacier uses the AWS account ID
--   associated with the credentials used to sign the request. If you use
--   an account ID, do not include any hyphens ('-') in the ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vaultName:UploadMultipartPart'</a>,
--   <a>uploadMultipartPart_vaultName</a> - The name of the vault.
--   
--   <a>$sel:uploadId:UploadMultipartPart'</a>,
--   <a>uploadMultipartPart_uploadId</a> - The upload ID of the multipart
--   upload.
--   
--   <a>$sel:range:UploadMultipartPart'</a>,
--   <a>uploadMultipartPart_range</a> - Identifies the range of bytes in
--   the assembled archive that will be uploaded in this part. Amazon S3
--   Glacier uses this information to assemble the archive in the proper
--   sequence. The format of this header follows RFC 2616. An example
--   header is Content-Range:bytes 0-4194303/*.
--   
--   <a>$sel:checksum:UploadMultipartPart'</a>,
--   <a>uploadMultipartPart_checksum</a> - The SHA256 tree hash of the data
--   being uploaded.
--   
--   <a>$sel:body:UploadMultipartPart'</a>, <a>uploadMultipartPart_body</a>
--   - The data to upload.
newUploadMultipartPart :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> HashedBody -> UploadMultipartPart

--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUploadMultipartPartResponse</a> smart constructor.

--   Strategy field and optionally a BytesPerHour field.
newDataRetrievalPolicy :: DataRetrievalPolicy

-- | Data retrieval policy rule.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDataRetrievalRule</a> smart constructor.
data DataRetrievalRule

--   omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   that can be retrieved in an hour.
--   
--   This field is required only if the value of the Strategy field is
--   <tt>BytesPerHour</tt>. Your PUT operation will be rejected if the
--   Strategy field is not set to <tt>BytesPerHour</tt> and you set this
--   field.
--   
--   <a>$sel:strategy:DataRetrievalRule'</a>,
--   <a>dataRetrievalRule_strategy</a> - The type of data retrieval policy
--   to set.
--   
--   Valid values: BytesPerHour|FreeTier|None
newDataRetrievalRule :: DataRetrievalRule

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeVaultOutput</a> with all optional fields

--   Coordinated Time (UTC) date when Amazon S3 Glacier completed the last
--   vault inventory. This value should be a string in the ISO 8601 date
--   format, for example <tt>2012-03-20T17:03:43.221Z</tt>.

--   archives in the vault as of the last inventory date. This field will
--   return null if an inventory has not yet run on the vault, for example
--   if you just created the vault.
--   
--   <a>$sel:numberOfArchives:DescribeVaultOutput'</a>,
--   <a>describeVaultOutput_numberOfArchives</a> - The number of archives
--   in the vault as of the last inventory date. This field will return
--   <tt>null</tt> if an inventory has not yet run on the vault, for
--   example if you just created the vault.
newDescribeVaultOutput :: DescribeVaultOutput

--   KMS key ID to use for object encryption. All GET and PUT requests for
--   an object protected by AWS KMS fail if not made by using Secure
--   Sockets Layer (SSL) or Signature Version 4.

--   <a>$sel:kmsContext:Encryption'</a>, <a>encryption_kmsContext</a> -
--   Optional. If the encryption type is <tt>aws:kms</tt>, you can use this
--   value to specify the encryption context for the job results.
newEncryption :: Encryption

-- | Contains the description of an Amazon S3 Glacier job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGlacierJobDescription</a> smart constructor.
data GlacierJobDescription
GlacierJobDescription' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe SelectParameters -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe StatusCode -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe ActionCode -> Maybe InventoryRetrievalJobDescription -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe OutputLocation -> GlacierJobDescription

-- | Create a value of <a>GlacierJobDescription</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sHA256TreeHash:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_sHA256TreeHash</a> - For an archive retrieval
--   job, this value is the checksum of the archive. Otherwise, this value
--   is null.
--   
--   The SHA256 tree hash value for the requested range of an archive. If
--   the <b>InitiateJob</b> request for an archive specified a tree-hash
--   aligned range, then this field returns a value.
--   
--   If the whole archive is retrieved, this value is the same as the
--   ArchiveSHA256TreeHash value.
--   
--   This field is null for the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Archive retrieval jobs that specify a range that is not tree-hash
--   aligned</li>
--   <li>Archival jobs that specify a range that is equal to the whole
--   archive, when the job status is <tt>InProgress</tt></li>
--   <li>Inventory jobs</li>
--   <li>Select jobs</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusMessage:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_statusMessage</a> - A friendly message that
--   describes the job status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobDescription:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_jobDescription</a> - The job description
--   provided when initiating the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:retrievalByteRange:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_retrievalByteRange</a> - The retrieved byte
--   range for archive retrieval jobs in the form
--   <i>StartByteValue</i>-<i>EndByteValue</i>. If no range was specified
--   in the archive retrieval, then the whole archive is retrieved. In this
--   case, <i>StartByteValue</i> equals 0 and <i>EndByteValue</i> equals
--   the size of the archive minus 1. For inventory retrieval or select
--   jobs, this field is null.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobOutputPath:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_jobOutputPath</a> - Contains the job output
--   location.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_creationDate</a> - The UTC date when the job
--   was created. This value is a string representation of ISO 8601 date
--   format, for example <tt>"2012-03-20T17:03:43.221Z"</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:selectParameters:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_selectParameters</a> - Contains the
--   parameters used for a select.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sNSTopic:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_sNSTopic</a> - An Amazon SNS topic that
--   receives notification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:vaultARN:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_vaultARN</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the vault from which an archive retrieval was requested.
--   
--   <a>$sel:archiveId:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_archiveId</a> - The archive ID requested for
--   a select job or archive retrieval. Otherwise, this field is null.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusCode:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_statusCode</a> - The status code can be
--   <tt>InProgress</tt>, <tt>Succeeded</tt>, or <tt>Failed</tt>, and
--   indicates the status of the job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inventorySizeInBytes:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_inventorySizeInBytes</a> - For an inventory
--   retrieval job, this value is the size in bytes of the inventory
--   requested for download. For an archive retrieval or select job, this
--   value is null.
--   
--   <a>$sel:archiveSizeInBytes:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_archiveSizeInBytes</a> - For an archive
--   retrieval job, this value is the size in bytes of the archive being
--   requested for download. For an inventory retrieval or select job, this
--   value is null.
--   
--   <a>$sel:action:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_action</a> - The job type. This value is
--   either <tt>ArchiveRetrieval</tt>, <tt>InventoryRetrieval</tt>, or
--   <tt>Select</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inventoryRetrievalParameters:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_inventoryRetrievalParameters</a> - Parameters
--   used for range inventory retrieval.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completionDate:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_completionDate</a> - The UTC time that the
--   job request completed. While the job is in progress, the value is
--   null.
--   
--   <a>$sel:completed:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_completed</a> - The job status. When a job is
--   completed, you get the job's output using Get Job Output (GET output).
--   
--   <a>$sel:archiveSHA256TreeHash:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_archiveSHA256TreeHash</a> - The SHA256 tree
--   hash of the entire archive for an archive retrieval. For inventory
--   retrieval or select jobs, this field is null.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tier:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_tier</a> - The tier to use for a select or an
--   archive retrieval. Valid values are <tt>Expedited</tt>,
--   <tt>Standard</tt>, or <tt>Bulk</tt>. <tt>Standard</tt> is the default.
--   
--   <a>$sel:jobId:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_jobId</a> - An opaque string that identifies
--   an Amazon S3 Glacier job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputLocation:GlacierJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>glacierJobDescription_outputLocation</a> - Contains the location
--   where the data from the select job is stored.
newGlacierJobDescription :: GlacierJobDescription

-- | Contains information about a grant.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGrant</a> smart constructor.
data Grant
Grant' :: Maybe Grantee -> Maybe Permission -> Grant

-- | Create a value of <a>Grant</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:grantee:Grant'</a>, <a>grant_grantee</a> - The grantee.
--   
--   <a>$sel:permission:Grant'</a>, <a>grant_permission</a> - Specifies the
--   permission given to the grantee.
newGrant :: Grant

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGrantee</a> smart constructor.

--   fields.

--   the grantee.

--   <a>$sel:displayName:Grantee'</a>, <a>grantee_displayName</a> - Screen
--   name of the grantee.
--   
--   <a>$sel:emailAddress:Grantee'</a>, <a>grantee_emailAddress</a> - Email
--   address of the grantee.
--

newGrantee :: Type -> Grantee

-- | Describes the options for a range inventory retrieval job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInventoryRetrievalJobDescription</a> smart
--   constructor.
data InventoryRetrievalJobDescription
InventoryRetrievalJobDescription' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> InventoryRetrievalJobDescription

-- | Create a value of <a>InventoryRetrievalJobDescription</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:startDate:InventoryRetrievalJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>inventoryRetrievalJobDescription_startDate</a> - The start of the
--   date range in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC) for vault inventory
--   retrieval that includes archives created on or after this date. This
--   value should be a string in the ISO 8601 date format, for example
--   <tt>2013-03-20T17:03:43Z</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:format:InventoryRetrievalJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>inventoryRetrievalJobDescription_format</a> - The output format for
--   the vault inventory list, which is set by the <b>InitiateJob</b>
--   request when initiating a job to retrieve a vault inventory. Valid
--   values are <tt>CSV</tt> and <tt>JSON</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endDate:InventoryRetrievalJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>inventoryRetrievalJobDescription_endDate</a> - The end of the date
--   range in UTC for vault inventory retrieval that includes archives
--   created before this date. This value should be a string in the ISO
--   8601 date format, for example <tt>2013-03-20T17:03:43Z</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:limit:InventoryRetrievalJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>inventoryRetrievalJobDescription_limit</a> - The maximum number of
--   inventory items returned per vault inventory retrieval request. This
--   limit is set when initiating the job with the a <b>InitiateJob</b>
--   request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:marker:InventoryRetrievalJobDescription'</a>,
--   <a>inventoryRetrievalJobDescription_marker</a> - An opaque string that
--   represents where to continue pagination of the vault inventory
--   retrieval results. You use the marker in a new <b>InitiateJob</b>
--   request to obtain additional inventory items. If there are no more
--   inventory items, this value is <tt>null</tt>. For more information,
--   see <a>Range Inventory Retrieval</a>.
newInventoryRetrievalJobDescription :: InventoryRetrievalJobDescription

-- | Provides options for specifying a range inventory retrieval job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInventoryRetrievalJobInput</a> smart constructor.
data InventoryRetrievalJobInput
InventoryRetrievalJobInput' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> InventoryRetrievalJobInput

-- | Create a value of <a>InventoryRetrievalJobInput</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   range in UTC for vault inventory retrieval that includes archives
--   created on or after this date. This value should be a string in the
--   ISO 8601 date format, for example <tt>2013-03-20T17:03:43Z</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endDate:InventoryRetrievalJobInput'</a>,
--   <a>inventoryRetrievalJobInput_endDate</a> - The end of the date range
--   in UTC for vault inventory retrieval that includes archives created
--   before this date. This value should be a string in the ISO 8601 date
--   format, for example <tt>2013-03-20T17:03:43Z</tt>.

--   <a>inventoryRetrievalJobInput_limit</a> - Specifies the maximum number
--   of inventory items returned per vault inventory retrieval request.
--   Valid values are greater than or equal to 1.
--   
--   <a>$sel:marker:InventoryRetrievalJobInput'</a>,
--   <a>inventoryRetrievalJobInput_marker</a> - An opaque string that
--   represents where to continue pagination of the vault inventory
--   retrieval results. You use the marker in a new <b>InitiateJob</b>
--   request to obtain additional inventory items. If there are no more
--   inventory items, this value is <tt>null</tt>.
newInventoryRetrievalJobInput :: InventoryRetrievalJobInput

-- | Provides options for defining a job.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newJobParameters</a> smart constructor.
data JobParameters
JobParameters' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe SelectParameters -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe InventoryRetrievalJobInput -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe OutputLocation -> JobParameters

-- | Create a value of <a>JobParameters</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:format:JobParameters'</a>, <a>jobParameters_format</a> - When
--   initiating a job to retrieve a vault inventory, you can optionally add
--   this parameter to your request to specify the output format. If you
--   are initiating an inventory job and do not specify a Format field,
--   JSON is the default format. Valid values are "CSV" and "JSON".
--   
--   <a>$sel:retrievalByteRange:JobParameters'</a>,
--   <a>jobParameters_retrievalByteRange</a> - The byte range to retrieve
--   for an archive retrieval. in the form
--   "<i>StartByteValue</i>-<i>EndByteValue</i>" If not specified, the
--   whole archive is retrieved. If specified, the byte range must be
--   megabyte (1024*1024) aligned which means that <i>StartByteValue</i>
--   must be divisible by 1 MB and <i>EndByteValue</i> plus 1 must be
--   divisible by 1 MB or be the end of the archive specified as the
--   archive byte size value minus 1. If RetrievalByteRange is not megabyte
--   aligned, this operation returns a 400 response.
--   
--   An error occurs if you specify this field for an inventory retrieval
--   job request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:selectParameters:JobParameters'</a>,
--   <a>jobParameters_selectParameters</a> - Contains the parameters that
--   define a job.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sNSTopic:JobParameters'</a>, <a>jobParameters_sNSTopic</a> -
--   The Amazon SNS topic ARN to which Amazon S3 Glacier sends a
--   notification when the job is completed and the output is ready for you
--   to download. The specified topic publishes the notification to its
--   subscribers. The SNS topic must exist.
--   
--   <a>$sel:archiveId:JobParameters'</a>, <a>jobParameters_archiveId</a> -
--   The ID of the archive that you want to retrieve. This field is
--   required only if <tt>Type</tt> is set to <tt>select</tt> or
--   <tt>archive-retrieval</tt>code&gt;. An error occurs if you specify
--   this request parameter for an inventory retrieval job request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:JobParameters'</a>,
--   <a>jobParameters_description</a> - The optional description for the
--   job. The description must be less than or equal to 1,024 bytes. The
--   allowable characters are 7-bit ASCII without control
--   codes-specifically, ASCII values 32-126 decimal or 0x20-0x7E
--   hexadecimal.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inventoryRetrievalParameters:JobParameters'</a>,
--   <a>jobParameters_inventoryRetrievalParameters</a> - Input parameters
--   used for range inventory retrieval.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':JobParameters'</a>, <a>jobParameters_type</a> - The job
--   type. You can initiate a job to perform a select query on an archive,
--   retrieve an archive, or get an inventory of a vault. Valid values are
--   "select", "archive-retrieval" and "inventory-retrieval".
--   
--   <a>$sel:tier:JobParameters'</a>, <a>jobParameters_tier</a> - The tier
--   to use for a select or an archive retrieval job. Valid values are
--   <tt>Expedited</tt>, <tt>Standard</tt>, or <tt>Bulk</tt>.
--   <tt>Standard</tt> is the default.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outputLocation:JobParameters'</a>,
--   <a>jobParameters_outputLocation</a> - Contains information about the
--   location where the select job results are stored.
newJobParameters :: JobParameters

-- | Contains information about the location where the select job results
--   are stored.

--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOutputLocation</a> smart constructor.

-- | Create a value of <a>S3Location</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   that is prepended to the results for this request.
--

--   canned access control list (ACL) to apply to the job results.
--

--   Contains information about the encryption used to store the job
--   results in Amazon S3.
--

--   The storage class used to store the job results.

--   A map of metadata to store with the job results in Amazon S3.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accessControlList:S3Location'</a>,
--   <a>s3Location_accessControlList</a> - A list of grants that control
--   access to the staged results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tagging:S3Location'</a>, <a>s3Location_tagging</a> - The
--   tag-set that is applied to the job results.
newS3Location :: S3Location
